52 #{table_html} 53
54
55 HTML 56 end 57 58 def render_page(page:, sort_col: nil, sort_dir: nil, filters: nil) 59 model_class = resolve_model 60 return ['', false] unless model_class 61 62 columns = @metadata['columns'] || [] 63 per_page = (@metadata['per_page'] || 25).to_i.clamp(1, 100) 64 sort_col ||= @metadata.dig('default_sort', 'column') || 'created_at' 65 sort_dir ||= @metadata.dig('default_sort', 'direction') || 'desc' 66 sort_dir = sort_dir.to_s.downcase == 'asc' ? 'asc' : 'desc' 67 filters ||= @metadata['filters'] || [] 68 69 scope = model_class.all 70 scope = apply_filters(scope, filters) 71 72 # Validate sort column exists 73 if model_class.column_names.include?(sort_col.to_s) 74 scope = scope.order(sort_col => sort_dir) 75 else 76 scope = scope.order(created_at: :desc) 77 end 78 79 total = scope.count 80 pagy = Pagy.new(count: total, page: page, limit: per_page) 81 records = scope.offset(pagy.offset).limit(pagy.limit) 82 83 rows_html = records.map { |record| build_row(record, columns) }.join 84 [rows_html, !pagy.next.nil?] 85 end 86 87 def refresh_data! 88 new_content = render_content 89 if new_content != @component.content 90 @component.update!(content: new_content) 91 true 92 else 93 false 94 end 95 end 96 97 private 98 99 def resolve_model 100 name = @metadata['model'].to_s.strip 101 return nil if name.empty? 102 103 klass = Fang.const_get(name) 104 klass < ActiveRecord::Base ? klass : nil 105 rescue NameError 106 nil 107 end 108 109 def apply_filters(scope, filters) 110 Array(filters).each do |f| 111 col = f['column'].to_s 112 op = f['operator'].to_s 113 val = f['value'] 114 next unless ALLOWED_OPERATORS.include?(op) && val 115 116 case op 117 when '=' then scope = scope.where(col => val) 118 when '!=' then scope = scope.where.not(col => val) 119 when 'like' then scope = scope.where("#{col} LIKE ?", "%#{val}%") 120 when '>' then scope = scope.where("#{col} > ?", val) 121 when '<' then scope = scope.where("#{col} < ?", val) 122 when '>=' then scope = scope.where("#{col} >= ?", val) 123 when '<=' then scope = scope.where("#{col} <= ?", val) 124 end 125 end 126 scope 127 end 128 129 def build_table(columns, rows_html, has_more, page:) 130 sort_col = @metadata.dig('default_sort', 'column') || 'created_at' 131 sort_dir = @metadata.dig('default_sort', 'direction') || 'desc' 132 cid = @component.id 133 134 colgroup = columns.map { |col| %() }.join 135 136 header = columns.map do |col| 137 sortable = col['sortable'] ? ' data-sortable="true"' : '' 138 sort_class = '' 139 if col['sortable'] && col['key'] == sort_col 140 sort_class = " sort-#{sort_dir}" 141 end 142 %(#{h col['label'] || col['key']}) 143 end.join 144 145 sentinel = '' 146 if has_more 147 next_page = page + 1 148 src = "/api/tables/#{cid}/rows?page=#{next_page}" 149 sentinel = %() 150 end 151 152 <<~HTML 153 154 #{colgroup} 155 #{header} 156 157 #{rows_html} 158 #{sentinel} 159 160
161 HTML 162 end 163 164 def build_static_table(columns) 165 result = evaluate_data_source 166 rows = result.is_a?(Array) ? result : (@metadata['rows'] || []) 167 168 colgroup = columns.map { |col| %() }.join 169 header = columns.map { |col| %(#{h col['label'] || col['key']}) }.join 170 rows_html = rows.map do |row| 171 cells = Array(row).map { |cell| "#{h cell}" }.join 172 "#{cells}" 173 end.join 174 175 <<~HTML 176 177 #{colgroup} 178 #{header} 179 #{rows_html} 180
181 HTML 182 end 183 184 def build_row(record, columns) 185 cells = columns.map do |col| 186 val = record.respond_to?(col['key']) ? record.send(col['key']) : nil 187 "#{format_cell(val, col['formatter'])}" 188 end.join 189 "#{cells}" 190 end 191 192 def format_cell(value, formatter) 193 return '-' if value.nil? 194 195 case formatter 196 when 'badge' 197 badge_class = case value.to_s 198 when 'pending' then 'warning' 199 when 'running' then 'info' 200 when 'completed', 'active', 'success' then 'success' 201 when 'failed', 'error' then 'error' 202 else '' 203 end 204 %(#{h value}) 205 when 'code' 206 %(#{h value}) 207 when 'date' 208 formatted = value.respond_to?(:strftime) ? value.strftime('%b %d, %Y %H:%M') : h(value) 209 formatted 210 when 'truncate' 211 %(#{h value}) 212 else 213 h(value) 214 end 215 end 216 217 def build_filter_chips 218 filters = @metadata['filters'] || [] 219 return '' if filters.empty? 220 221 chips = filters.map do |f| 222 %(#{h f['column']} #{h f['operator']} #{h f['value']}) 223 end.join(' ') 224 %(
#{chips}
) 225 end 226 227 def empty_state 228 %(
No columns configured
) 229 end 230 end 231 end 232end 233

content.text:
I now have a comprehensive understanding of the entire codebase. Here is a thorough report of all findings: --- ## OpenFang Codebase - Comprehensive Exploration Report --- ### 1. Layout System **File:** `/home/greg/Developer/openfang/web/views/layout.erb` The layout uses a full-height flex column (`h-dvh flex flex-col overflow-hidden`) divided into three vertical layers: **a) Sidebar (slide-in overlay)** - Pure CSS toggle using `` no JavaScript needed for open/close - Fixed 16rem wide panel, translates off-screen by default, slides in with `transform: translateX(0)` when checkbox is checked - Contains the OpenFang brand name and a `
` of `Fang::Page.published.recent` pages - Nav links use `onclick` with `window.chatFooter?.openCanvas(...)` to open a canvas in the chat footer instead of navigating - Semi-transparent backdrop overlay via `::before` pseudo-element on `.sidebar-container` **b) Navbar (fixed header)** - Height: `h-14`, `border-b`, sits at top of the flex column - Contains: hamburger nav-trigger label, "OpenFang" brand, notifications bell icon with badge count - Notifications use a Stimulus controller (`data-controller="notifications"`) with a dropdown **c) Canvas Area (flex-1 middle zone)** - `overflow-hidden relative`, fills all space between header and chat footer - Two things live here simultaneously: 1. `` regular page content (max-w-7xl, centered) 2. `
` canvas overlays (absolutely positioned, `inset:0`) - Canvas overlays use `display:none` / `display:block` via `.active` class **d) Chat Footer (bottom panel)** - Fixed-height bottom section, resizable via drag handle - `data-controller="chat-footer"` (Stimulus) - Two tab bars stacked vertically: - Canvas-level tabs (muted background) top - Conversation-level tabs (smaller) bottom - Panels container for conversation chat panels **e) Context Menu (singleton)** - `
` at document root - Shared across all canvases, repositioned dynamically --- ### 2. Canvas System **Overview:** Each canvas is a `Page` record. Canvases are rendered as absolutely-positioned overlays inside `#conversation-canvases`. Multiple canvases can exist simultaneously but only one is `.active` (visible) at a time. **Structure per canvas overlay:** ```html
100%
``` **Canvas Controller** (`/home/greg/Developer/openfang/web/public/js/controllers/canvas_controller.js`): State tracked per canvas: - `this.scale` (zoom, 0.13.0, default 1.0) - `this.panX/panY` (translation offset) - `this.scrollLock` (wheel scrolls vertically instead of zooming) - `this.editLock` (disables drag, enables text selection) Transforms applied to `.canvas-world`: ```js this.world.style.transform = `translate(${panX}px, ${panY}px) scale(${scale})` ``` Pan/Drag handling: - Left-click on background -> panning (disabled in scroll-lock mode) - Left-click on `.canvas-component` -> dragging that component - Zoom: scroll wheel on canvas, zoom toward cursor point - Touch: single finger pan/drag - Position persisted on `mouseup`/`touchend` via `PATCH /api/pages/{pageId}/components/{compId}` MutationObserver watches `.canvas-world` for added/removed `.canvas-component` elements and calls widget `init`/`destroy` lifecycle hooks. --- ### 3. Canvas Components / Cards **DB Table:** `canvas_components` (`/home/greg/Developer/openfang/workspace/migrations/20260218000001_create_canvas_components.rb`) Columns: - `page_id` (FK to pages) - `component_type` (string, default: `'card'`) - `content` (text rendered HTML) - `x`, `y`, `width` (float) absolute positioning in canvas world space - `height` (float, optional) - `z_index` (integer) - `metadata` (JSON blob widget-specific structured config) Also: `pages.canvas_state` (JSON) stores `scroll_locked` etc. **Ruby Model:** `/home/greg/Developer/openfang/fang/models/canvas_component.rb` - `belongs_to :page`, `has_many :canvas_components` (via Page) - `as_canvas_json` serializes to JSON for API - `render_html` delegates to widget class's `render_component_html` - `render_content_html` delegates to widget class's `render_content` **HTML structure of a component:** ```html
{rendered HTML}
``` --- ### 4. Widget System **Base class:** `/home/greg/Developer/openfang/fang/widgets/base_widget.rb` Uses ObjectSpace auto-discovery any class inheriting `BaseWidget` and calling `widget_type 'name'` is auto-registered in `BaseWidget.registry`. `for_type(type)` does lookup. **All Widget Types:** | Widget type | Class file | menu_label | Purpose | |---|---|---|---| | `card` | `note_widget.rb` | Add Note | Free-form HTML note, double-click to edit | | `clock` | `clock_widget.rb` | Add Clock | Live updating clock with timezone | | `chart` | `chart_widget.rb` | Add Chart | Chart.js chart (bar/line/pie/etc.) | | `metric` | `metric_widget.rb` | Add Metric | Big number KPI with trend arrow | | `list` | `list_widget.rb` | Add List | Item list, optional links + subtitles | | `banner` | `banner_widget.rb` | Add Banner | Colored notice (info/success/warning/error) | | `weather` | `weather_widget.rb` | Add Weather | Live weather from wttr.in | | `data_table` | `data_table_widget.rb` | Data Table | Paginated sortable DB-backed table | | `scheduled_jobs` | `scheduled_jobs_widget.rb` | Jobs & Skills | Dashboard of scheduled tasks + skills | | `heartbeat_monitor` | `heartbeat_monitor_widget.rb` | Heartbeat Monitor | Heartbeat grid + run history cells | | `table` | `table_widget.rb` | (not read) | Sortable data table (simpler version) | | `settings` | `settings_widget.rb` | (not read) | Settings UI widget | | `hacker_news` | `hacker_news_widget.rb` | (not read) | HN feed | **Refresh system:** Widgets declare `self.refreshable? = true` and `self.refresh_interval`. `refresh_data!` re-queries data and updates `component.content` if changed. Broadcast via `TurboBroadcast.broadcast("canvas:#{page_id}", turbo_stream)`. **Client-side widget behaviors** (`/home/greg/Developer/openfang/web/public/js/widgets/`): - `registry.js`: `window.widgetBehaviors = {}`, `window.registerWidget(type, behavior)` - `clock.js`: Sets interval to update `[data-clock-display]` every second - `chart.js`: Initializes Chart.js instance via `Fang.renderChart` - `data_table.js`: Adds sort click handlers on `th[data-sortable]`, column resize drag on `.col-resize-handle`, reloads body via `turbo-frame` --- ### 5. Chat Footer Controller **File:** `/home/greg/Developer/openfang/web/public/js/controllers/chat_footer_controller.js` Two-level state tree: ``` canvases[] (array) {pageId, title, slug, conversations[], activeConvId} conversations: [{id, title, slug}] ``` Key flows: - **`openCanvas(pageId, title, slug, convId?, convTitle?, convSlug?)`** creates canvas tab, creates canvas overlay DOM, expands footer, switches to that canvas, opens/creates conversation - **`switchCanvas(pageId)`** closes SSE of previous canvas, opens SSE for new one, re-renders conversation tabs, shows correct canvas overlay, activates conversation - **`_createCanvasOverlay(pageId)`** creates a `div.conversation-canvas` in `#conversation-canvases`, calls `_loadCanvasByPage` to fetch components from API and render them - **`_loadCanvasByPage(pageId, container)`** fetches `GET /api/pages/{pageId}/canvas`, builds the dot-grid/world/zoom-indicator HTML, renders all components via `_renderCanvasComponent` - **`newTab()`** POSTs to `/api/canvases` to create a Page+Conversation pair, then calls `openCanvas` - **SSE** via `EventSource("/api/pages/{pageId}/stream")` receives Turbo Stream messages, calls `Turbo.renderStreamMessage` - **Resize handle** drag up/down to resize footer height, persisted in `sessionStorage` - **State persistence** `sessionStorage.chatState` stores full tree, restored on page load - **URL management** `history.pushState` to `/{canvasSlug}/{convSlug}` - **`sendMessage`** POSTs to `/conversations/{id}/messages`, optimistically appends user message + thinking dots --- ### 6. Context Menu System **Location:** Singleton `
` in layout, positioned `fixed` at `z-index:10000` **Canvas context menu items** (dynamically loaded from `/api/widget_types`): - One "Add {Label}" item per registered widget type - Separator - "Scroll Lock: On/Off" - "Edit Lock: On/Off" - "Reset View" **Component context menu items:** - "Chat about this" creates new conversation, prefills textarea with component content preview - "Duplicate" fetches component JSON, re-creates it offset by 24px - Separator - "Delete" (destructive red styling) **CSS** (`style.css` lines 11001155): - `.canvas-context-menu` `position:fixed`, `min-width:180px`, `padding:0.25rem`, `animation:ctx-menu-in` - `.canvas-context-menu-item` transparent bg, green ring on focus - `.canvas-context-menu-item.destructive` `color:var(--destructive)` with light red hover - `.canvas-context-menu-separator` 1px border line --- ### 7. Routing Canvas-Related Routes **`web/app.rb`:** | Route | Purpose | |---|---| | `GET /api/pages/:id/canvas` | Returns `{components: [...], canvas_state: {}}` | | `GET /api/pages/:id/stream` | SSE stream for canvas updates | | `POST /api/pages/:id/components` | Create component, broadcasts via SSE | | `PATCH /api/pages/:id/components/:id` | Update position/content/metadata | | `DELETE /api/pages/:id/components/:id` | Delete, broadcasts remove stream | | `GET /api/pages/:id/components/:id` | Get single component JSON | | `GET /api/widget_types` | List all registered widget types | | `POST /api/canvases` | Create Page+Conversation pair | | `POST /api/conversations` | Create conversation | | `GET /api/tables/:id/rows` | Paginated data table rows (turbo-frame) | | `POST /api/actions` | Execute widget actions (run_skill, run_code, send_message, etc.) | | `GET /:slug` | Render canvas_view.erb (catch-all slug route) | | `GET /:slug/:chat_slug` | Same, with conversation pre-selected | The `canvas_view.erb` view is tiny just a script tag that calls `chatFooter.openCanvas(...)` on `DOMContentLoaded`. --- ### 8. Design System (CSS Tokens) **File:** `/home/greg/Developer/openfang/web/public/css/style.css` Light mode (`:root`): ```css --background: #c8ccd1 --foreground: #0f172a --card: #dde0e4 --muted: #b8bcc2 --muted-foreground: #4a5568 --primary: #16a34a (green accent) --border: #a8adb4 --ring: #16a34a --input: #e8eaee --destructive: #dc2626 ``` Dark mode (`@media prefers-color-scheme: dark`): ```css --background: #09090b --card: #18181b --muted: #27272a --muted-foreground: #a1a1aa --primary: #16a34a --border: #27272a ``` Note: The CLAUDE.md docs show different light mode values (white/light gray), but the actual `style.css` shows a medium gray palette for light mode. The dark mode matches docs. Shadow scale: `--shadow-sm`, `--shadow-md`, `--shadow-lg` Radius scale: `--radius-sm: 0.25rem`, `--radius-md: 0.375rem`, `--radius-lg: 0.5rem` **Component classes:** - `.card` `border:1px solid var(--border)`, `background:var(--card)`, `padding:1.5rem`, `border-radius:var(--radius-lg)`, `box-shadow:var(--shadow-sm)` - `.badge` pill label, variants: `.success`, `.error`, `.warning`, `.info` - `button` green bg default, `.ghost`, `.outline`, `.sm`, `.xs`, `.icon` variants - `.chat-msg.user` / `.chat-msg.ai` full-width chat messages with border-top separator - `.prose-bubble` markdown content inside chat, `p/h1-h6/ul/ol/code/pre/blockquote` styles - `.canvas-component` absolute positioned, card style, `cursor:grab` - `.canvas-component.dragging` elevated shadow, `z-index:9999`, `cursor:grabbing` - `.canvas-component.canvas-component-highlight` pulsing green ring on "Chat about this" - Two-level tab system: `.chat-tab-bar.canvas-level` (muted bg) + `.chat-tab-bar.conversation-level` (smaller) --- ### 9. Page Creation and Display Pages are created via: 1. **MCP tool** `create_page` (`/home/greg/Developer/openfang/fang/tools/create_page_tool.rb`) AI-driven, creates `Page` with title/content/status, links to `CONVERSATION_ID` env var 2. **`POST /api/canvases`** creates a Page + Conversation together, used by the "+" button in the canvas tab bar Once created, a page's slug appears automatically in the sidebar nav via `Fang::Page.published.recent.each`. Clicking a nav link calls `chatFooter.openCanvas(page.id, title, slug)` via inline `onclick`. The `page_show.erb` view renders at `/pages/:slug` shows title, published date, conversation buttons, and `@page.content` via `render_markdown`. This is a fallback for direct URL access; normally pages open as canvas overlays. The `canvas_view.erb` is used for slug-matched routes (`/:slug`) and just fires `chatFooter.openCanvas(...)` on load, making the canvas overlay appear. --- ### 10. `fang-components.js` Client Utility Library **File:** `/home/greg/Developer/openfang/web/public/js/fang-components.js` - `Fang.renderChart(canvas, config)` wraps Chart.js, applies theme colors from CSS vars, merges options, destroys existing chart on element first - `initSortableTable(table)` makes `[data-fang-table]` tables client-side sortable (numeric-aware) - `initActionButton(btn)` handles `[data-fang-action]` buttons: POSTs to `/api/actions`, shows spinner/loading text, success/error states with 23s timeout reset - `initFangElements(root)` initializes all the above on a subtree - `MutationObserver` on `document.body` to auto-init elements added via Turbo Streams --- ### Summary of Key Files | File | Role | |---|---| | `/home/greg/Developer/openfang/web/views/layout.erb` | Full app shell: sidebar, navbar, canvas area, chat footer, context menu singleton | | `/home/greg/Developer/openfang/web/public/js/controllers/chat_footer_controller.js` | Canvas tab management, SSE, conversation panels, resize, state persistence | | `/home/greg/Developer/openfang/web/public/js/controllers/canvas_controller.js` | Pan/zoom/drag, widget lifecycle, context menu, edit/scroll lock, position persistence | | `/home/greg/Developer/openfang/web/public/css/style.css` | Full design system: tokens, all component CSS, canvas CSS, chat footer CSS | | `/home/greg/Developer/openfang/web/app.rb` | All Roda routes including full canvas API | | `/home/greg/Developer/openfang/fang/models/canvas_component.rb` | DB model, widget delegation, JSON serialization | | `/home/greg/Developer/openfang/fang/models/page.rb` | Page model with canvas_components has_many | | `/home/greg/Developer/openfang/fang/widgets/base_widget.rb` | Widget base with ObjectSpace registry, HTML rendering | | `/home/greg/Developer/openfang/web/public/js/fang-components.js` | Chart.js wrapper, action buttons, sortable tables | | `/home/greg/Developer/openfang/web/views/canvas_view.erb` | Tiny view just fires openCanvas() on DOMContentLoaded |

` of `Fang::Page.published.recent` pages - Nav links use `onclick` with `window.chatFooter?.openCanvas(...)` to open a canvas in the chat footer instead of navigating - Semi-transparent backdrop overlay via `::before` pseudo-element on `.sidebar-container` **b) Navbar (fixed header)** - Height: `h-14`, `border-b`, sits at top of the flex column - Contains: hamburger nav-trigger label, "OpenFang" brand, notifications bell icon with badge count - Notifications use a Stimulus controller (`data-controller="notifications"`) with a dropdown **c) Canvas Area (flex-1 middle zone)** - `overflow-hidden relative`, fills all space between header and chat footer - Two things live here simultaneously: 1. `` regular page content (max-w-7xl, centered) 2. `
` canvas overlays (absolutely positioned, `inset:0`) - Canvas overlays use `display:none` / `display:block` via `.active` class **d) Chat Footer (bottom panel)** - Fixed-height bottom section, resizable via drag handle - `data-controller="chat-footer"` (Stimulus) - Two tab bars stacked vertically: - Canvas-level tabs (muted background) top - Conversation-level tabs (smaller) bottom - Panels container for conversation chat panels **e) Context Menu (singleton)** - `
` at document root - Shared across all canvases, repositioned dynamically --- ### 2. Canvas System **Overview:** Each canvas is a `Page` record. Canvases are rendered as absolutely-positioned overlays inside `#conversation-canvases`. Multiple canvases can exist simultaneously but only one is `.active` (visible) at a time. **Structure per canvas overlay:** ```html
100%
``` **Canvas Controller** (`/home/greg/Developer/openfang/web/public/js/controllers/canvas_controller.js`): State tracked per canvas: - `this.scale` (zoom, 0.13.0, default 1.0) - `this.panX/panY` (translation offset) - `this.scrollLock` (wheel scrolls vertically instead of zooming) - `this.editLock` (disables drag, enables text selection) Transforms applied to `.canvas-world`: ```js this.world.style.transform = `translate(${panX}px, ${panY}px) scale(${scale})` ``` Pan/Drag handling: - Left-click on background -> panning (disabled in scroll-lock mode) - Left-click on `.canvas-component` -> dragging that component - Zoom: scroll wheel on canvas, zoom toward cursor point - Touch: single finger pan/drag - Position persisted on `mouseup`/`touchend` via `PATCH /api/pages/{pageId}/components/{compId}` MutationObserver watches `.canvas-world` for added/removed `.canvas-component` elements and calls widget `init`/`destroy` lifecycle hooks. --- ### 3. Canvas Components / Cards **DB Table:** `canvas_components` (`/home/greg/Developer/openfang/workspace/migrations/20260218000001_create_canvas_components.rb`) Columns: - `page_id` (FK to pages) - `component_type` (string, default: `'card'`) - `content` (text rendered HTML) - `x`, `y`, `width` (float) absolute positioning in canvas world space - `height` (float, optional) - `z_index` (integer) - `metadata` (JSON blob widget-specific structured config) Also: `pages.canvas_state` (JSON) stores `scroll_locked` etc. **Ruby Model:** `/home/greg/Developer/openfang/fang/models/canvas_component.rb` - `belongs_to :page`, `has_many :canvas_components` (via Page) - `as_canvas_json` serializes to JSON for API - `render_html` delegates to widget class's `render_component_html` - `render_content_html` delegates to widget class's `render_content` **HTML structure of a component:** ```html
{rendered HTML}
``` --- ### 4. Widget System **Base class:** `/home/greg/Developer/openfang/fang/widgets/base_widget.rb` Uses ObjectSpace auto-discovery any class inheriting `BaseWidget` and calling `widget_type 'name'` is auto-registered in `BaseWidget.registry`. `for_type(type)` does lookup. **All Widget Types:** | Widget type | Class file | menu_label | Purpose | |---|---|---|---| | `card` | `note_widget.rb` | Add Note | Free-form HTML note, double-click to edit | | `clock` | `clock_widget.rb` | Add Clock | Live updating clock with timezone | | `chart` | `chart_widget.rb` | Add Chart | Chart.js chart (bar/line/pie/etc.) | | `metric` | `metric_widget.rb` | Add Metric | Big number KPI with trend arrow | | `list` | `list_widget.rb` | Add List | Item list, optional links + subtitles | | `banner` | `banner_widget.rb` | Add Banner | Colored notice (info/success/warning/error) | | `weather` | `weather_widget.rb` | Add Weather | Live weather from wttr.in | | `data_table` | `data_table_widget.rb` | Data Table | Paginated sortable DB-backed table | | `scheduled_jobs` | `scheduled_jobs_widget.rb` | Jobs & Skills | Dashboard of scheduled tasks + skills | | `heartbeat_monitor` | `heartbeat_monitor_widget.rb` | Heartbeat Monitor | Heartbeat grid + run history cells | | `table` | `table_widget.rb` | (not read) | Sortable data table (simpler version) | | `settings` | `settings_widget.rb` | (not read) | Settings UI widget | | `hacker_news` | `hacker_news_widget.rb` | (not read) | HN feed | **Refresh system:** Widgets declare `self.refreshable? = true` and `self.refresh_interval`. `refresh_data!` re-queries data and updates `component.content` if changed. Broadcast via `TurboBroadcast.broadcast("canvas:#{page_id}", turbo_stream)`. **Client-side widget behaviors** (`/home/greg/Developer/openfang/web/public/js/widgets/`): - `registry.js`: `window.widgetBehaviors = {}`, `window.registerWidget(type, behavior)` - `clock.js`: Sets interval to update `[data-clock-display]` every second - `chart.js`: Initializes Chart.js instance via `Fang.renderChart` - `data_table.js`: Adds sort click handlers on `th[data-sortable]`, column resize drag on `.col-resize-handle`, reloads body via `turbo-frame` --- ### 5. Chat Footer Controller **File:** `/home/greg/Developer/openfang/web/public/js/controllers/chat_footer_controller.js` Two-level state tree: ``` canvases[] (array) {pageId, title, slug, conversations[], activeConvId} conversations: [{id, title, slug}] ``` Key flows: - **`openCanvas(pageId, title, slug, convId?, convTitle?, convSlug?)`** creates canvas tab, creates canvas overlay DOM, expands footer, switches to that canvas, opens/creates conversation - **`switchCanvas(pageId)`** closes SSE of previous canvas, opens SSE for new one, re-renders conversation tabs, shows correct canvas overlay, activates conversation - **`_createCanvasOverlay(pageId)`** creates a `div.conversation-canvas` in `#conversation-canvases`, calls `_loadCanvasByPage` to fetch components from API and render them - **`_loadCanvasByPage(pageId, container)`** fetches `GET /api/pages/{pageId}/canvas`, builds the dot-grid/world/zoom-indicator HTML, renders all components via `_renderCanvasComponent` - **`newTab()`** POSTs to `/api/canvases` to create a Page+Conversation pair, then calls `openCanvas` - **SSE** via `EventSource("/api/pages/{pageId}/stream")` receives Turbo Stream messages, calls `Turbo.renderStreamMessage` - **Resize handle** drag up/down to resize footer height, persisted in `sessionStorage` - **State persistence** `sessionStorage.chatState` stores full tree, restored on page load - **URL management** `history.pushState` to `/{canvasSlug}/{convSlug}` - **`sendMessage`** POSTs to `/conversations/{id}/messages`, optimistically appends user message + thinking dots --- ### 6. Context Menu System **Location:** Singleton `
` in layout, positioned `fixed` at `z-index:10000` **Canvas context menu items** (dynamically loaded from `/api/widget_types`): - One "Add {Label}" item per registered widget type - Separator - "Scroll Lock: On/Off" - "Edit Lock: On/Off" - "Reset View" **Component context menu items:** - "Chat about this" creates new conversation, prefills textarea with component content preview - "Duplicate" fetches component JSON, re-creates it offset by 24px - Separator - "Delete" (destructive red styling) **CSS** (`style.css` lines 11001155): - `.canvas-context-menu` `position:fixed`, `min-width:180px`, `padding:0.25rem`, `animation:ctx-menu-in` - `.canvas-context-menu-item` transparent bg, green ring on focus - `.canvas-context-menu-item.destructive` `color:var(--destructive)` with light red hover - `.canvas-context-menu-separator` 1px border line --- ### 7. Routing Canvas-Related Routes **`web/app.rb`:** | Route | Purpose | |---|---| | `GET /api/pages/:id/canvas` | Returns `{components: [...], canvas_state: {}}` | | `GET /api/pages/:id/stream` | SSE stream for canvas updates | | `POST /api/pages/:id/components` | Create component, broadcasts via SSE | | `PATCH /api/pages/:id/components/:id` | Update position/content/metadata | | `DELETE /api/pages/:id/components/:id` | Delete, broadcasts remove stream | | `GET /api/pages/:id/components/:id` | Get single component JSON | | `GET /api/widget_types` | List all registered widget types | | `POST /api/canvases` | Create Page+Conversation pair | | `POST /api/conversations` | Create conversation | | `GET /api/tables/:id/rows` | Paginated data table rows (turbo-frame) | | `POST /api/actions` | Execute widget actions (run_skill, run_code, send_message, etc.) | | `GET /:slug` | Render canvas_view.erb (catch-all slug route) | | `GET /:slug/:chat_slug` | Same, with conversation pre-selected | The `canvas_view.erb` view is tiny just a script tag that calls `chatFooter.openCanvas(...)` on `DOMContentLoaded`. --- ### 8. Design System (CSS Tokens) **File:** `/home/greg/Developer/openfang/web/public/css/style.css` Light mode (`:root`): ```css --background: #c8ccd1 --foreground: #0f172a --card: #dde0e4 --muted: #b8bcc2 --muted-foreground: #4a5568 --primary: #16a34a (green accent) --border: #a8adb4 --ring: #16a34a --input: #e8eaee --destructive: #dc2626 ``` Dark mode (`@media prefers-color-scheme: dark`): ```css --background: #09090b --card: #18181b --muted: #27272a --muted-foreground: #a1a1aa --primary: #16a34a --border: #27272a ``` Note: The CLAUDE.md docs show different light mode values (white/light gray), but the actual `style.css` shows a medium gray palette for light mode. The dark mode matches docs. Shadow scale: `--shadow-sm`, `--shadow-md`, `--shadow-lg` Radius scale: `--radius-sm: 0.25rem`, `--radius-md: 0.375rem`, `--radius-lg: 0.5rem` **Component classes:** - `.card` `border:1px solid var(--border)`, `background:var(--card)`, `padding:1.5rem`, `border-radius:var(--radius-lg)`, `box-shadow:var(--shadow-sm)` - `.badge` pill label, variants: `.success`, `.error`, `.warning`, `.info` - `button` green bg default, `.ghost`, `.outline`, `.sm`, `.xs`, `.icon` variants - `.chat-msg.user` / `.chat-msg.ai` full-width chat messages with border-top separator - `.prose-bubble` markdown content inside chat, `p/h1-h6/ul/ol/code/pre/blockquote` styles - `.canvas-component` absolute positioned, card style, `cursor:grab` - `.canvas-component.dragging` elevated shadow, `z-index:9999`, `cursor:grabbing` - `.canvas-component.canvas-component-highlight` pulsing green ring on "Chat about this" - Two-level tab system: `.chat-tab-bar.canvas-level` (muted bg) + `.chat-tab-bar.conversation-level` (smaller) --- ### 9. Page Creation and Display Pages are created via: 1. **MCP tool** `create_page` (`/home/greg/Developer/openfang/fang/tools/create_page_tool.rb`) AI-driven, creates `Page` with title/content/status, links to `CONVERSATION_ID` env var 2. **`POST /api/canvases`** creates a Page + Conversation together, used by the "+" button in the canvas tab bar Once created, a page's slug appears automatically in the sidebar nav via `Fang::Page.published.recent.each`. Clicking a nav link calls `chatFooter.openCanvas(page.id, title, slug)` via inline `onclick`. The `page_show.erb` view renders at `/pages/:slug` shows title, published date, conversation buttons, and `@page.content` via `render_markdown`. This is a fallback for direct URL access; normally pages open as canvas overlays. The `canvas_view.erb` is used for slug-matched routes (`/:slug`) and just fires `chatFooter.openCanvas(...)` on load, making the canvas overlay appear. --- ### 10. `fang-components.js` Client Utility Library **File:** `/home/greg/Developer/openfang/web/public/js/fang-components.js` - `Fang.renderChart(canvas, config)` wraps Chart.js, applies theme colors from CSS vars, merges options, destroys existing chart on element first - `initSortableTable(table)` makes `[data-fang-table]` tables client-side sortable (numeric-aware) - `initActionButton(btn)` handles `[data-fang-action]` buttons: POSTs to `/api/actions`, shows spinner/loading text, success/error states with 23s timeout reset - `initFangElements(root)` initializes all the above on a subtree - `MutationObserver` on `document.body` to auto-init elements added via Turbo Streams --- ### Summary of Key Files | File | Role | |---|---| | `/home/greg/Developer/openfang/web/views/layout.erb` | Full app shell: sidebar, navbar, canvas area, chat footer, context menu singleton | | `/home/greg/Developer/openfang/web/public/js/controllers/chat_footer_controller.js` | Canvas tab management, SSE, conversation panels, resize, state persistence | | `/home/greg/Developer/openfang/web/public/js/controllers/canvas_controller.js` | Pan/zoom/drag, widget lifecycle, context menu, edit/scroll lock, position persistence | | `/home/greg/Developer/openfang/web/public/css/style.css` | Full design system: tokens, all component CSS, canvas CSS, chat footer CSS | | `/home/greg/Developer/openfang/web/app.rb` | All Roda routes including full canvas API | | `/home/greg/Developer/openfang/fang/models/canvas_component.rb` | DB model, widget delegation, JSON serialization | | `/home/greg/Developer/openfang/fang/models/page.rb` | Page model with canvas_components has_many | | `/home/greg/Developer/openfang/fang/widgets/base_widget.rb` | Widget base with ObjectSpace registry, HTML rendering | | `/home/greg/Developer/openfang/web/public/js/fang-components.js` | Chart.js wrapper, action buttons, sortable tables | | `/home/greg/Developer/openfang/web/views/canvas_view.erb` | Tiny view just fires openCanvas() on DOMContentLoaded |

input.prompt:
Describe the full feature set, UI design, interaction patterns, and visual style of this app. Focus on:
1. The canvas/grid system - how cards are laid out
2. Card types and what they contain
3. The sidebar/navigation (GRIDS, pages)
4. Visual design: colors, typography, borders, shadows, spacing
5. Context menu / toolbar for cards (the floating toolbar with move, style, font size, duplicate, delete icons)
6. Website card feature - embedding/following website snippets
7. Any interaction patterns (drag, resize, zoom, pan)
8. The overall dark theme aesthetic
9. Card header styling (colored titles with emoji/icons)
10. How the sidebar shows page counts

content.content:
# Nova App  Feature Set & Design Analysis

## 1. Canvas/Grid System
Nova uses a freeform spatial layout  "place anything anywhere" with no folders or hierarchy. The canvas expands dynamically as content grows. Users can create **multiple grids** for different contexts and switch between them instantly. There's no enforced structure; it's described as a "blank slate."

## 2. Card Types
- **Note cards**  basic text/thought containers; resizable and repositionable
- **AI cards**  context-injected AI responses from Anthropic, OpenAI, Gemini, Grok, or Mistral
- **Website cards**  live snippets of websites, eliminating manual refreshing
- Cards are described as "containers for your thoughts" that users resize and move freely

## 3. Navigation / Sidebar
The sidebar lists named grids (not traditional folder hierarchies). **Grid links** allow jumping between grids to connect related thought spaces. Navigation is context-based rather than file-tree-based.

## 4. Visual Design
- **Dark theme** primary aesthetic with light mode option and custom themes (Nova X)
- Clean, minimal, "distraction-free" interface
- Screenshot suggests dark background with card-based floating panels
- Spacing appears generous with clear card boundaries

## 5. Card Toolbar
Not explicitly detailed in the source, but cards support: move, resize, and organizational actions implied by the freeform canvas description.

## 6. Website Cards
Users "follow a snippet of a website instead of refreshing every day," keeping live content visible persistently on the grid  a passive monitoring feature.

## 7. Interaction Patterns
- **Drag & drop** card placement anywhere on the canvas
- **Resize** cards freely
- **Pan/expand**  grid grows as needed
- **Instant switching** between multiple grids

## 8. Dark Theme Aesthetic
Described by users as "clean" and "distraction-free." The hero screenshot shows a dark-canvas environment with floating card elements.

## 9. Card Header Styling
Not explicitly described in the source text beyond general card container behavior.

## 10. Sidebar Page Counts
Not explicitly detailed in the provided content.

---

**Pricing**: Free tier includes multiple grids and note cards. Nova X ($4.99/mo or lifetime) adds AI cards, website cards, themes, grid links, and cloud sync via iCloud or Google Drive. Pricing uses a dynamic model where "price for new subscribers increases as more people join."

content.thinking:
Now I have a good understanding of both the current OpenFang codebase and what Nova looks like. Let me analyze the screenshots more carefully:

From the first screenshot:
- Dark theme with warm-toned dark background
- Sidebar on left with "GRIDS" heading, "+" button to add new grids, list of grid names with counts (Base Camp 12, Orbit Home 5, Mind Palace 5, etc.)
- Canvas area with freely positioned cards
- Cards have colored title headers (NEWS in red/orange, WEATHER in teal, MORNING ROUTINE in amber, etc.)
- Cards have a small icon/pin button in top-right corner


- The cards display diverse content typesnews feeds, weather widgets, checklists, text blocks, images, and status indicators
- A floating toolbar appears when selecting a card, offering move, styling, font sizing, duplication, and deletion options

The main visual departures from OpenFang are the warmer color palette, the grid/page organization in the sidebar with item counts, the colored card headers with icons, the floating card toolbar, and the ability to embed live website snippets directly into cards.

Now I'm mapping out the implementation strategy. I'll need to overhaul the visual theme toward warmer tones, redesign the card headers with colored text and icons, swap the context menu for a floating toolbar that appears on selection, add a new widget type for website embeds, enhance the sidebar to display canvas counts, and refine how cards move and interact on the canvas. Let me spin up a planning agent to work through the design details.

content.text: Now let me design the implementation plan.

input.prompt:
Design an implementation plan to transform the OpenFang canvas UI to match the look and feel of the Nova app (nova.lightmode.io) while keeping the terminal chat at the bottom.

## Current State

OpenFang already has:
- A canvas system with pan/zoom/drag in `web/public/js/controllers/canvas_controller.js`
- Widget system with auto-discovery in `fang/widgets/base_widget.rb`
- Canvas components model in `fang/models/canvas_component.rb` (has x, y, width, height, z_index, metadata JSON, component_type, content)
- Context menu in `canvas_controller.js` with right-click to add widgets, delete, duplicate
- Chat footer with canvas tabs at bottom in `web/public/js/controllers/chat_footer_controller.js`
- CSS design system in `web/public/css/style.css` with CSS custom properties
- Multiple widget types: card/note, clock, chart, metric, list, banner, weather, data_table, etc.
- Sidebar nav in `web/views/layout.erb` listing pages
- Routes in `web/app.rb` for canvas API

## What Nova Looks Like (from screenshots)

1. **Dark warm theme** - Not pure black, slightly warm dark background. Cards are darker than background with subtle borders
2. **Card headers** - Colored title text (red for NEWS, teal for WEATHER, amber for MORNING ROUTINE, green for FOOD TRACKER). Small emoji/icon before title. Title text is bold, uppercase, colored. Small pin/settings icon in top-right corner of cards
3. **Floating toolbar on card selection** (second screenshot) - When a card is selected, a small floating toolbar appears below it with icons: crosshair/move, diamond/style, A A A (three font sizes), duplicate, delete. Dark rounded bar with icon buttons
4. **Sidebar** - Shows "GRIDS" heading with "+" button. Lists grid names with component counts (e.g., "Base Camp 12", "Night Mode 5"). Settings gear icon at top
5. **Website cards** - "Follow a snippet of a website instead of refreshing every day" - embeds live website content as a card
6. **Free-form spatial canvas** - Cards positioned freely, no grid snapping
7. **Card content types visible**: HN news feed, weather, checklists with checkboxes, image embeds, AI assistant text, book lists, system status with colored dots, navigation buttons, quote/inspiration

## Changes Needed

### 1. Visual Theme Update (style.css)
- Warm up the dark theme slightly (e.g., background from #09090b to something like #1a1a1e or #1c1917)
- Card backgrounds slightly lighter than canvas background
- Softer, warmer border colors
- Cards should have subtle rounded corners, minimal shadow

### 2. Card Header Redesign
- Each card should have a colored title with an optional icon/emoji
- Title text: bold, slightly larger, colored per-card (store color in metadata)
- Small action icon (pin/settings/grip) in top-right
- Add `title_color` and `icon` fields to component metadata

### 3. Floating Toolbar (replaces right-click context menu for components)
- When a component is clicked/selected, show a floating dark toolbar below it
- Toolbar icons: Move (crosshair), Style (diamond - opens color picker for title), Font size (A A A - cycle through sizes), Duplicate, Delete
- Toolbar follows the component, dismisses on click-away
- Keep the canvas background right-click context menu for adding new widgets

### 4. Website Card Widget (new widget type)
- New widget: `website_widget.rb` with `widget_type 'website'`
- Metadata: `{ url: "...", selector: "..." (optional CSS selector), refresh_interval: 3600 }`
- Server-side: fetch URL, extract content (optionally via CSS selector), cache rendered HTML
- Client-side: display the fetched snippet, auto-refresh on interval
- Refreshable widget that re-fetches periodically
- Uses ApplicationClient or Net::HTTP to fetch the page

### 5. Sidebar Enhancement
- Show canvas/grid count next to each page name (count of canvas_components)
- Add "+" button at top to create new canvas
- Show "GRIDS" or "CANVASES" heading
- Style to match Nova's sidebar: clean, dark, with count badges

### 6. Canvas Context Menu Update
- Keep right-click on background for "Add widget" submenu
- Remove component-specific items from context menu (moved to floating toolbar)
- Add "Scroll Lock" and "Edit Lock" toggles
- Add "Reset View" option

### 7. Component Selection State
- Click on a component to "select" it (show selection border + floating toolbar)
- Click away to deselect
- Selected state: subtle green/accent border glow

## Implementation Order

1. Visual theme update (CSS only, low risk)
2. Card header redesign (CSS + metadata + widget rendering)
3. Component selection state (JS)
4. Floating toolbar (JS + CSS, replaces component context menu)
5. Sidebar enhancement (ERB + CSS)
6. Website card widget (new Ruby widget + JS + route)
7. Canvas context menu cleanup

## Files to Modify

- `web/public/css/style.css` - Theme + card + toolbar + sidebar styles
- `web/public/js/controllers/canvas_controller.js` - Selection state, floating toolbar, context menu changes
- `web/views/layout.erb` - Sidebar redesign
- `fang/widgets/base_widget.rb` - Add header rendering with color/icon support
- `fang/widgets/*.rb` - Update existing widgets to provide default colors/icons
- `fang/models/canvas_component.rb` - Helper for metadata access (title_color, icon)
- `web/app.rb` - Route for website card proxy/fetch
- NEW: `fang/widgets/website_widget.rb` - Website snippet widget
- NEW: `web/public/js/widgets/website.js` - Client-side refresh behavior

Please provide a detailed, step-by-step implementation plan covering all these changes.

3. **Floating toolbar on card selection** (second screenshot) - When a card is selected, a small floating toolbar appears below it with icons: crosshair/move, diamond/style, A A A (three font sizes), duplicate, delete. Dark rounded bar with icon buttons
4. **Sidebar** - Shows "GRIDS" heading with "+" button. Lists grid names with component counts (e.g., "Base Camp 12", "Night Mode 5"). Settings gear icon at top
5. **Website cards** - "Follow a snippet of a website instead of refreshing every day" - embeds live website content as a card
6. **Free-form spatial canvas** - Cards positioned freely, no grid snapping
7. **Card content types visible**: HN news feed, weather, checklists with checkboxes, image embeds, AI assistant text, book lists, system status with colored dots, navigation buttons, quote/inspiration

## Changes Needed

### 1. Visual Theme Update (style.css)
- Warm up the dark theme slightly (e.g., background from #09090b to something like #1a1a1e or #1c1917)
- Card backgrounds slightly lighter than canvas background
- Softer, warmer border colors
- Cards should have subtle rounded corners, minimal shadow

### 2. Card Header Redesign
- Each card should have a colored title with an optional icon/emoji
- Title text: bold, slightly larger, colored per-card (store color in metadata)
- Small action icon (pin/settings/grip) in top-right
- Add `title_color` and `icon` fields to component metadata

### 3. Floating Toolbar (replaces right-click context menu for components)
- When a component is clicked/selected, show a floating dark toolbar below it
- Toolbar icons: Move (crosshair), Style (diamond - opens color picker for title), Font size (A A A - cycle through sizes), Duplicate, Delete
- Toolbar follows the component, dismisses on click-away
- Keep the canvas background right-click context menu for adding new widgets

### 4. Website Card Widget (new widget type)
- New widget: `website_widget.rb` with `widget_type 'website'`
- Metadata: `{ url: "...", selector: "..." (optional CSS selector), refresh_interval: 3600 }`
- Server-side: fetch URL, extract content (optionally via CSS selector), cache rendered HTML
- Client-side: display the fetched snippet, auto-refresh on interval
- Refreshable widget that re-fetches periodically
- Uses ApplicationClient or Net::HTTP to fetch the page

### 5. Sidebar Enhancement
- Show canvas/grid count next to each page name (count of canvas_components)
- Add "+" button at top to create new canvas
- Show "GRIDS" or "CANVASES" heading
- Style to match Nova's sidebar: clean, dark, with count badges

### 6. Canvas Context Menu Update
- Keep right-click on background for "Add widget" submenu
- Remove component-specific items from context menu (moved to floating toolbar)
- Add "Scroll Lock" and "Edit Lock" toggles
- Add "Reset View" option

### 7. Component Selection State
- Click on a component to "select" it (show selection border + floating toolbar)
- Click away to deselect
- Selected state: subtle green/accent border glow

## Implementation Order

1. Visual theme update (CSS only, low risk)
2. Card header redesign (CSS + metadata + widget rendering)
3. Component selection state (JS)
4. Floating toolbar (JS + CSS, replaces component context menu)
5. Sidebar enhancement (ERB + CSS)
6. Website card widget (new Ruby widget + JS + route)
7. Canvas context menu cleanup

## Files to Modify

- `web/public/css/style.css` - Theme + card + toolbar + sidebar styles
- `web/public/js/controllers/canvas_controller.js` - Selection state, floating toolbar, context menu changes
- `web/views/layout.erb` - Sidebar redesign
- `fang/widgets/base_widget.rb` - Add header rendering with color/icon support
- `fang/widgets/*.rb` - Update existing widgets to provide default colors/icons
- `fang/models/canvas_component.rb` - Helper for metadata access (title_color, icon)
- `web/app.rb` - Route for website card proxy/fetch
- NEW: `fang/widgets/website_widget.rb` - Website snippet widget
- NEW: `web/public/js/widgets/website.js` - Client-side refresh behavior

Please provide a detailed, step-by-step implementation plan covering all these changes.

content.content:
1import { Controller } from "https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/@hotwired/stimulus@3.2.2/dist/stimulus.js"
     2
     3export default class extends Controller {
     4  static values = { pageId: Number, scrollLocked: { type: Boolean, default: false } }
     5
     6  connect() {
     7    this.scale = 1.0
     8    this.panX = 0
     9    this.panY = 0
    10    this.isPanning = false
    11    this.isDragging = false
    12    this.dragTarget = null
    13    this.startX = 0
    14    this.startY = 0
    15    this.startElX = 0
    16    this.startElY = 0
    17    this.scrollLock = this.scrollLockedValue
    18    this.editLock = false
    19
    20    this.world = this.element.querySelector(".canvas-world")
    21    if (!this.world) return
    22
    23    // Apply scroll lock class if initial value is true
    24    if (this.scrollLock) {
    25      this.element.classList.add("scroll-locked")
    26    }
    27
    28    // Bind events
    29    this.onMouseDown = this.onMouseDown.bind(this)
    30    this.onMouseMove = this.onMouseMove.bind(this)
    31    this.onMouseUp = this.onMouseUp.bind(this)
    32    this.onWheel = this.onWheel.bind(this)
    33
    34    this.element.addEventListener("mousedown", this.onMouseDown)
    35    document.addEventListener("mousemove", this.onMouseMove)
    36    document.addEventListener("mouseup", this.onMouseUp)
    37    this.element.addEventListener("wheel", this.onWheel, { passive: false })
    38
    39    // Touch events
    40    this.onTouchStart = this.onTouchStart.bind(this)
    41    this.onTouchMove = this.onTouchMove.bind(this)
    42    this.onTouchEnd = this.onTouchEnd.bind(this)
    43    this.element.addEventListener("touchstart", this.onTouchStart, { passive: false })
    44    document.addEventListener("touchmove", this.onTouchMove, { passive: false })
    45    document.addEventListener("touchend", this.onTouchEnd)
    46
    47    // Double-click to edit
    48    this.onDblClick = this.onDblClick.bind(this)
    49    this.element.addEventListener("dblclick", this.onDblClick)
    50
    51    // Context menu
    52    this.onContextMenu = this.onContextMenu.bind(this)
    53    this.onDocumentClick = this.onDocumentClick.bind(this)
    54    this.onKeyDown = this.onKeyDown.bind(this)
    55    this.element.addEventListener("contextmenu", this.onContextMenu)
    56    document.addEventListener("click", this.onDocumentClick)
    57    document.addEventListener("keydown", this.onKeyDown)
    58    this.menu = document.getElementById("canvas-context-menu")
    59    this.menuItems = document.getElementById("canvas-context-menu-items")
    60
    61    // Configurable menu item registries  built from widget types API
    62    this.canvasMenuItems = [
    63      { label: "Add Note", action: (wx, wy) => this.addWidget('card', wx, wy) },
    64      { separator: true },
    65      { label: () => this.scrollLock ? "Scroll Lock: On" : "Scroll Lock: Off", action: () => this.toggleScrollLock() },
    66      { label: () => this.editLock ? "Edit Lock: On" : "Edit Lock: Off", action: () => this.toggleEditLock() },
    67      { label: "Reset View", action: () => this.resetView() },
    68    ]
    69
    70    // Fetch widget types and rebuild menu dynamically
    71    this._loadWidgetTypes()
    72
    73    this.componentMenuItems = [
    74      { label: "Chat about this", action: (comp) => this.chatAboutComponent(comp) },
    75      { label: "Duplicate", action: (comp) => this.duplicateComponent(comp) },
    76      { separator: true },
    77      { label: "Delete", destructive: true, action: (comp) => this.deleteComponent(comp) },
    78    ]
    79
    80    // Expose for extensibility
    81    window.canvasController = this
    82
    83    // MutationObserver for Turbo Stream updates
    84    this.observer = new MutationObserver((mutations) => {
    85      for (const mutation of mutations) {
    86        for (const node of mutation.addedNodes) {
    87          if (node.classList?.contains("canvas-component")) {
    88            this.initComponent(node)
    89          }
    90        }
    91        for (const node of mutation.removedNodes) {
    92          if (node.classList?.contains("canvas-component")) {
    93            this.destroyComponent(node)
    94          }
    95        }
    96      }
    97    })
    98    this.observer.observe(this.world, { childList: true })
    99
   100    // Init existing components
   101    this.world.querySelectorAll(".canvas-component").forEach(c => this.initComponent(c))
   102
   103    this.updateTransform()
   104    this.updateZoomIndicator()
   105  }
   106
   107  disconnect() {
   108    this.element.removeEventListener("mousedown", this.onMouseDown)
   109    document.removeEventListener("mousemove", this.onMouseMove)
   110    document.removeEventListener("mouseup", this.onMouseUp)
   111    this.element.removeEventListener("wheel", this.onWheel)
   112    this.element.removeEventListener("touchstart", this.onTouchStart)
   113    document.removeEventListener("touchmove", this.onTouchMove)
   114    document.removeEventListener("touchend", this.onTouchEnd)
   115    this.element.removeEventListener("dblclick", this.onDblClick)
   116    this.element.removeEventListener("contextmenu", this.onContextMenu)
   117    document.removeEventListener("click", this.onDocumentClick)
   118    document.removeEventListener("keydown", this.onKeyDown)
   119    this.observer?.disconnect()
   120    if (window.canvasController === this) window.canvasController = null
   121  }
   122
   123  initComponent(el) {
   124    el.style.zIndex = el.dataset.z || 0
   125    const type = el.dataset.widgetType
   126    if (type && window.widgetBehaviors?.[type]?.init) {
   127      try {
   128        const meta = JSON.parse(el.dataset.widgetMetadata || '{}')
   129        window.widgetBehaviors[type].init(el, meta)
   130      } catch (e) {
   131        console.error(`[Canvas] Widget init failed for ${type}:`, e)
   132      }
   133    }
   134  }
   135
   136  destroyComponent(el) {
   137    const type = el.dataset.widgetType
   138    if (type && window.widgetBehaviors?.[type]?.destroy) {
   139      try {
   140        window.widgetBehaviors[type].destroy(el)
   141      } catch (e) {
   142        console.error(`[Canvas] Widget destroy failed for ${type}:`, e)
   143      }
   144    }
   145  }
   146
   147  // --- Double-click to Edit ---
   148
   149  onDblClick(e) {
   150    const component = e.target.closest(".canvas-component")
   151    if (!component) return
   152
   153    const contentEl = component.querySelector(".canvas-component-content")
   154    if (!contentEl || contentEl.isContentEditable) return
   155
   156    // Enter edit mode
   157    this.editingComponent = component
   158    contentEl.contentEditable = "true"
   159    contentEl.style.cursor = "text"
   160    contentEl.style.userSelect = "text"
   161    component.style.cursor = "auto"
   162    contentEl.focus()
   163
   164    // Select all text
   165    const range = document.createRange()
   166    range.selectNodeContents(contentEl)
   167    const sel = window.getSelection()
   168    sel.removeAllRanges()
   169    sel.addRange(range)
   170
   171    // Save on blur
   172    const onBlur = () => {
   173      contentEl.removeEventListener("blur", onBlur)
   174      contentEl.removeEventListener("keydown", onKeyDown)
   175      this.finishEditing(component, contentEl)
   176    }
   177
   178    // Escape cancels, Cmd/Ctrl+Enter confirms
   179    const onKeyDown = (ev) => {
   180      if (ev.key === "Escape") {
   181        ev.preventDefault()
   182        contentEl.removeEventListener("blur", onBlur)
   183        contentEl.removeEventListener("keydown", onKeyDown)
   184        this.finishEditing(component, contentEl)
   185      }
   186    }
   187
   188    contentEl.addEventListener("blur", onBlur)
   189    contentEl.addEventListener("keydown", onKeyDown)
   190
   191    e.preventDefault()
   192    e.stopPropagation()
   193  }
   194
   195  finishEditing(component, contentEl) {
   196    contentEl.contentEditable = "false"
   197    contentEl.style.cursor = ""
   198    contentEl.style.userSelect = ""
   199    component.style.cursor = "grab"
   200    this.editingComponent = null
   201
   202    // Persist updated content
   203    const compId = component.dataset.componentId
   204    const pageId = this.pageIdValue
   205    if (!compId || !pageId) return
   206
   207    const newContent = contentEl.innerHTML
   208    fetch(`/api/pages/${pageId}/components/${compId}`, {
   209      method: "PATCH",
   210      headers: { "Content-Type": "application/x-www-form-urlencoded" },
   211      body: `content=${encodeURIComponent(newContent)}`
   212    }).catch(e => console.error("[Canvas] Failed to save content:", e))
   213  }
   214
   215  // --- Context Menu ---
   216
   217  onContextMenu(e) {
   218    e.preventDefault()
   219    const component = e.target.closest(".canvas-component")
   220    if (component) {
   221      this.showComponentMenu(e.clientX, e.clientY, component)
   222    } else {
   223      const rect = this.element.getBoundingClientRect()
   224      const worldX = (e.clientX - rect.left - this.panX) / this.scale
   225      const worldY = (e.clientY - rect.top - this.panY) / this.scale
   226      this.showCanvasMenu(e.clientX, e.clientY, worldX, worldY)
   227    }
   228  }
   229
   230  showCanvasMenu(screenX, screenY, worldX, worldY) {
   231    this.menuItems.innerHTML = ""
   232    for (const item of this.canvasMenuItems) {
   233      if (item.separator) {
   234        this.menuItems.appendChild(Object.assign(document.createElement("div"), { className: "canvas-context-menu-separator" }))
   235      } else {
   236        const label = typeof item.label === "function" ? item.label() : item.label
   237        const btn = document.createElement("button")
   238        btn.className = "canvas-context-menu-item"
   239        btn.textContent = label
   240        btn.addEventListener("click", () => { this.hideMenu(); item.action(worldX, worldY) })
   241        this.menuItems.appendChild(btn)
   242      }
   243    }
   244    this.positionAndShowMenu(screenX, screenY)
   245  }
   246
   247  showComponentMenu(screenX, screenY, component) {
   248    this.menuItems.innerHTML = ""
   249    for (const item of this.componentMenuItems) {
   250      if (item.separator) {
   251        this.menuItems.appendChild(Object.assign(document.createElement("div"), { className: "canvas-context-menu-separator" }))
   252      } else {
   253        const label = typeof item.label === "function" ? item.label() : item.label
   254        const btn = document.createElement("button")
   255        btn.className = "canvas-context-menu-item" + (item.destructive ? " destructive" : "")
   256        btn.textContent = label
   257        btn.addEventListener("click", () => { this.hideMenu(); item.action(component) })
   258        this.menuItems.appendChild(btn)
   259      }
   260    }
   261    this.positionAndShowMenu(screenX, screenY)
   262  }
   263
   264  positionAndShowMenu(x, y) {
   265    this.menu.style.display = "block"
   266    // Avoid viewport overflow
   267    const menuRect = this.menu.getBoundingClientRect()
   268    if (x + menuRect.width > window.innerWidth) x = window.innerWidth - menuRect.width - 8
   269    if (y + menuRect.height > window.innerHeight) y = window.innerHeight - menuRect.height - 8
   270    this.menu.style.left = x + "px"
   271    this.menu.style.top = y + "px"
   272  }
   273
   274  hideMenu() {
   275    if (this.menu) this.menu.style.display = "none"
   276  }
   277
   278  onDocumentClick(e) {
   279    if (this.menu && !this.menu.contains(e.target)) this.hideMenu()
   280  }
   281
   282  onKeyDown(e) {
   283    if (e.key === "Escape") this.hideMenu()
   284  }
   285
   286  // --- Context Menu Actions ---
   287
   288  async createComponent(attrs) {
   289    const pageId = this.pageIdValue
   290    if (!pageId) return null
   291    try {
   292      const resp = await fetch(`/api/pages/${pageId}/components`, {
   293        method: "POST",
   294        headers: { "Content-Type": "application/json" },
   295        body: JSON.stringify(attrs)
   296      })
   297      return await resp.json()
   298    } catch (e) {
   299      console.error("[Canvas] Failed to create component:", e)
   300      return null
   301    }
   302  }
   303
   304  addWidget(type, x, y, metadata = {}) {
   305    const widgetType = this._widgetTypes?.find(w => w.type === type)
   306    const defaults = widgetType?.defaults || {}
   307    this.createComponent({
   308      component_type: type,
   309      x, y,
   310      width: type === 'card' ? 240 : 280,
   311      metadata: { ...defaults, ...metadata }
   312    })
   313  }
   314
   315  async _loadWidgetTypes() {
   316    try {
   317      const resp = await fetch('/api/widget_types')
   318      const data = await resp.json()
   319      this._widgetTypes = data.widget_types || []
   320
   321      // Rebuild canvas menu: widget items + separator + utility items
   322      const widgetItems = this._widgetTypes.map(w => ({
   323        label: w.label,
   324        action: (wx, wy) => this.addWidget(w.type, wx, wy)
   325      }))
   326
   327      const utilityItems = [
   328        { label: () => this.scrollLock ? "Scroll Lock: On" : "Scroll Lock: Off", action: () => this.toggleScrollLock() },
   329        { label: () => this.editLock ? "Edit Lock: On" : "Edit Lock: Off", action: () => this.toggleEditLock() },
   330        { label: "Reset View", action: () => this.resetView() },
   331      ]
   332
   333      this.canvasMenuItems = [...widgetItems, { separator: true }, ...utilityItems]
   334    } catch (e) {
   335      console.warn("[Canvas] Failed to load widget types, using defaults:", e)
   336    }
   337  }
   338
   339  async chatAboutComponent(comp) {
   340    const compId = comp.dataset.componentId
   341    const content = comp.querySelector(".canvas-component-content")?.textContent?.trim() || ""
   342    const preview = content.substring(0, 120)
   343    const pageId = this.pageIdValue
   344    const footer = window.chatFooter
   345
   346    if (!footer || !pageId) return
   347
   348    // Highlight the component on the canvas
   349    comp.classList.add("canvas-component-highlight")
   350    setTimeout(() => comp.classList.remove("canvas-component-highlight"), 2000)
   351
   352    // Derive a title from the component content
   353    const firstLine = content.split("\n").find(l => l.trim()) || ""
   354    const title = firstLine.substring(0, 50) || `Widget #${compId}`
   355
   356    // Create a new conversation in this canvas with the widget title
   357    try {
   358      const resp = await fetch("/api/conversations", {
   359        method: "POST",
   360        headers: { "Content-Type": "application/x-www-form-urlencoded" },
   361        body: `ai_page_id=${pageId}&title=${encodeURIComponent(title)}`
   362      })
   363      const data = await resp.json()
   364
   365      // Ensure the canvas is open, then open the new conversation
   366      const canvas = footer.canvases.find(c => c.pageId === pageId)
   367      if (canvas) {
   368        footer.openConversation(data.id, data.title, data.slug, pageId)
   369      } else {
   370        footer.openCanvas(pageId, title, "", data.id, data.title, data.slug)
   371      }
   372
   373      // Prefill the textarea with a reference to the component
   374      const prefill = `[Re: canvas widget #${compId}]\n"${preview}"\n\n`
   375      const tryPrefill = (attempts) => {
   376        const panel = document.querySelector(".chat-panel.active")
   377        const textarea = panel?.querySelector("textarea")
   378        if (textarea) {
   379          textarea.value = prefill
   380          textarea.focus()
   381          textarea.setSelectionRange(prefill.length, prefill.length)
   382        } else if (attempts > 0) {
   383          setTimeout(() => tryPrefill(attempts - 1), 200)
   384        }
   385      }
   386      tryPrefill(5)
   387    } catch (e) {
   388      console.error("[Canvas] Failed to create conversation for component:", e)
   389    }
   390  }
   391
   392  async duplicateComponent(comp) {
   393    const compId = comp.dataset.componentId
   394    const pageId = this.pageIdValue
   395    if (!compId || !pageId) return
   396
   397    try {
   398      const resp = await fetch(`/api/pages/${pageId}/components/${compId}`)
   399      const data = await resp.json()
   400      this.createComponent({
   401        component_type: data.type,
   402        content: data.content,
   403        x: (data.x || 0) + 24,
   404        y: (data.y || 0) + 24,
   405        width: data.width,
   406        height: data.height,
   407        z_index: data.z_index,
   408        metadata: data.metadata
   409      })
   410    } catch (e) {
   411      console.error("[Canvas] Failed to duplicate component:", e)
   412    }
   413  }
   414
   415  async deleteComponent(comp) {
   416    const compId = comp.dataset.componentId
   417    const pageId = this.pageIdValue
   418    if (!compId || !pageId) return
   419
   420    // Clean up widget behavior before removal
   421    this.destroyComponent(comp)
   422    comp.remove()
   423
   424    try {
   425      await fetch(`/api/pages/${pageId}/components/${compId}`, { method: "DELETE" })
   426    } catch (e) {
   427      console.error("[Canvas] Failed to delete component:", e)
   428    }
   429  }
   430
   431  toggleScrollLock() {
   432    this.scrollLock = !this.scrollLock
   433    this.element.classList.toggle("scroll-locked", this.scrollLock)
   434    this.updateZoomIndicator()
   435  }
   436
   437  toggleEditLock() {
   438    this.editLock = !this.editLock
   439    this.element.classList.toggle("edit-locked", this.editLock)
   440    this.updateZoomIndicator()
   441  }
   442
   443  updateScrollLockIndicator() {
   444    // Merged into updateZoomIndicator
   445    this.updateZoomIndicator()
   446  }
   447
   448  resetView() {
   449    this.scale = 1.0
   450    this.panX = 0
   451    this.panY = 0
   452    this.updateTransform()
   453    this.updateZoomIndicator()
   454  }
   455
   456  // --- Pan & Drag (Mouse) ---
   457
   458  onMouseDown(e) {
   459    if (e.button !== 0) return // Only primary (left) button
   460    // Don't drag while editing
   461    if (this.editingComponent) return
   462    const component = e.target.closest(".canvas-component")
   463    if (component && this.editLock) {
   464      // Edit lock: let the event pass through for normal HTML behavior
   465      return
   466    }
   467    if (component) {
   468      // Start dragging component (works in both normal and scroll-lock mode)
   469      this.isDragging = true
   470      this.dragTarget = component
   471      this.startX = e.clientX
   472      this.startY = e.clientY
   473      this.startElX = parseFloat(component.style.left) || 0
   474      this.startElY = parseFloat(component.style.top) || 0
   475      component.classList.add("dragging")
   476      e.preventDefault()
   477    } else if (!this.scrollLock && (e.target === this.element || e.target === this.world || e.target.classList.contains("canvas-dot-grid"))) {
   478      // Start panning (disabled in scroll-lock mode)
   479      this.isPanning = true
   480      this.startX = e.clientX
   481      this.startY = e.clientY
   482      this.startPanX = this.panX
   483      this.startPanY = this.panY
   484      this.element.style.cursor = "grabbing"
   485      e.preventDefault()
   486    }
   487  }
   488
   489  onMouseMove(e) {
   490    if (this.isPanning) {
   491      this.panX = this.startPanX + (e.clientX - this.startX)
   492      this.panY = this.startPanY + (e.clientY - this.startY)
   493      this.updateTransform()
   494    } else if (this.isDragging && this.dragTarget) {
   495      const dx = (e.clientX - this.startX) / this.scale
   496      const dy = (e.clientY - this.startY) / this.scale
   497      this.dragTarget.style.left = (this.startElX + dx) + "px"
   498      this.dragTarget.style.top = (this.startElY + dy) + "px"
   499    }
   500  }
   501
   502  onMouseUp(e) {
   503    if (this.isPanning) {
   504      this.isPanning = false
   505      this.element.style.cursor = ""
   506    }
   507    if (this.isDragging && this.dragTarget) {
   508      this.dragTarget.classList.remove("dragging")
   509      this.saveComponentPosition(this.dragTarget)
   510      this.isDragging = false
   511      this.dragTarget = null
   512    }
   513  }
   514
   515  // --- Touch ---
   516
   517  onTouchStart(e) {
   518    if (e.touches.length !== 1) return
   519    const touch = e.touches[0]
   520    const component = touch.target.closest(".canvas-component")
   521    if (component && this.editLock) {
   522      // Edit lock: let the event pass through for normal HTML behavior
   523      return
   524    }
   525    if (component) {
   526      // Allow dragging in both normal and scroll-lock mode
   527      this.isDragging = true
   528      this.dragTarget = component
   529      this.startX = touch.clientX
   530      this.startY = touch.clientY
   531      this.startElX = parseFloat(component.style.left) || 0
   532      this.startElY = parseFloat(component.style.top) || 0
   533      component.classList.add("dragging")
   534      e.preventDefault()
   535    } else if (!this.scrollLock) {
   536      this.isPanning = true
   537      this.startX = touch.clientX
   538      this.startY = touch.clientY
   539      this.startPanX = this.panX
   540      this.startPanY = this.panY
   541      e.preventDefault()
   542    }
   543  }
   544
   545  onTouchMove(e) {
   546    if (e.touches.length !== 1) return
   547    const touch = e.touches[0]
   548    if (this.isPanning) {
   549      this.panX = this.startPanX + (touch.clientX - this.startX)
   550      this.panY = this.startPanY + (touch.clientY - this.startY)
   551      this.updateTransform()
   552    } else if (this.isDragging && this.dragTarget) {
   553      const dx = (touch.clientX - this.startX) / this.scale
   554      const dy = (touch.clientY - this.startY) / this.scale
   555      this.dragTarget.style.left = (this.startElX + dx) + "px"
   556      this.dragTarget.style.top = (this.startElY + dy) + "px"
   557      e.preventDefault()
   558    }
   559  }
   560
   561  onTouchEnd() {
   562    if (this.isPanning) this.isPanning = false
   563    if (this.isDragging && this.dragTarget) {
   564      this.dragTarget.classList.remove("dragging")
   565      this.saveComponentPosition(this.dragTarget)
   566      this.isDragging = false
   567      this.dragTarget = null
   568    }
   569  }
   570
   571  // --- Zoom ---
   572
   573  onWheel(e) {
   574    e.preventDefault()
   575
   576    if (this.scrollLock) {
   577      // Scroll lock: wheel scrolls vertically (pans Y only)
   578      this.panY -= e.deltaY
   579      this.updateTransform()
   580      return
   581    }
   582
   583    const delta = e.deltaY > 0 ? -0.08 : 0.08
   584    const newScale = Math.min(Math.max(this.scale + delta, 0.1), 3.0)
   585
   586    // Zoom toward cursor
   587    const rect = this.element.getBoundingClientRect()
   588    const cx = e.clientX - rect.left
   589    const cy = e.clientY - rect.top
   590
   591    const ratio = newScale / this.scale
   592    this.panX = cx - ratio * (cx - this.panX)
   593    this.panY = cy - ratio * (cy - this.panY)
   594    this.scale = newScale
   595
   596    this.updateTransform()
   597    this.updateZoomIndicator()
   598  }
   599
   600  updateTransform() {
   601    if (this.world) {
   602      this.world.style.transform = `translate(${this.panX}px, ${this.panY}px) scale(${this.scale})`
   603      this.world.style.width = ""
   604      this.world.style.height = ""
   605    }
   606  }
   607
   608  updateZoomIndicator() {
   609    const indicator = this.element.querySelector(".canvas-zoom-indicator")
   610    if (!indicator) return
   611
   612    const zoom = Math.round(this.scale * 100) + "%"
   613
   614    // SVG icons (14px, stroke-based, 1.5px stroke)
   615    const scrollIcon = `<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="14" height="14" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="1.5" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M12 3v18"/><path d="m8 6 4-3 4 3"/><path d="m8 18 4 3 4-3"/></svg>`
   616    const editLockOffIcon = `<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="14" height="14" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="1.5" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M5 9l4-4 4 4"/><path d="M9 5v10"/><path d="M19 15l-4 4-4-4"/><path d="M15 19V9"/></svg>`
   617    const editLockOnIcon = `<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="14" height="14" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="1.5" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><rect x="3" y="11" width="18" height="11" rx="2" ry="2"/><path d="M7 11V7a5 5 0 0 1 10 0v4"/></svg>`
   618
   619    indicator.innerHTML = `<span>${zoom}</span><button class="canvas-toolbar-btn${this.scrollLock ? ' active' : ''}" title="Toggle scroll lock">${scrollIcon}</button><button class="canvas-toolbar-btn${this.editLock ? ' active' : ''}" title="Toggle edit lock">${this.editLock ? editLockOnIcon : editLockOffIcon}</button>`
   620    indicator.style.pointerEvents = "auto"
   621
   622    const buttons = indicator.querySelectorAll(".canvas-toolbar-btn")
   623    buttons[0].onclick = (e) => { e.stopPropagation(); this.toggleScrollLock() }
   624    buttons[1].onclick = (e) => { e.stopPropagation(); this.toggleEditLock() }
   625  }
   626
   627  // --- Persist position ---
   628
   629  async saveComponentPosition(el) {
   630    const componentId = el.dataset.componentId
   631    const pageId = this.pageIdValue
   632    if (!componentId || !pageId) return
   633
   634    const x = parseFloat(el.style.left) || 0
   635    const y = parseFloat(el.style.top) || 0
   636
   637    try {
   638      await fetch(`/api/pages/${pageId}/components/${componentId}`, {
   639        method: "PATCH",
   640        headers: { "Content-Type": "application/x-www-form-urlencoded" },
   641        body: `x=${x}&y=${y}`
   642      })
   643    } catch (e) {
   644      console.error("[Canvas] Failed to save position:", e)
   645    }
   646
   647  }
   648}

data.prompt:
Design an implementation plan to transform the OpenFang canvas UI to match the look and feel of the Nova app (nova.lightmode.io) while keeping the terminal chat at the bottom.

## Current State

OpenFang already has:
- A canvas system with pan/zoom/drag in `web/public/js/controllers/canvas_controller.js`
- Widget system with auto-discovery in `fang/widgets/base_widget.rb`
- Canvas components model in `fang/models/canvas_component.rb` (has x, y, width, height, z_index, metadata JSON, component_type, content)
- Context menu in `canvas_controller.js` with right-click to add widgets, delete, duplicate
- Chat footer with canvas tabs at bottom in `web/public/js/controllers/chat_footer_controller.js`
- CSS design system in `web/public/css/style.css` with CSS custom properties
- Multiple widget types: card/note, clock, chart, metric, list, banner, weather, data_table, etc.
- Sidebar nav in `web/views/layout.erb` listing pages
- Routes in `web/app.rb` for canvas API

## What Nova Looks Like (from screenshots)

1. **Dark warm theme** - Not pure black, slightly warm dark background. Cards are darker than background with subtle borders
2. **Card headers** - Colored title text (red for NEWS, teal for WEATHER, amber for MORNING ROUTINE, green for FOOD TRACKER). Small emoji/icon before title. Title text is bold, uppercase, colored. Small pin/settings icon in top-right corner of cards
3. **Floating toolbar on card selection** (second screenshot) - When a card is selected, a small floating toolbar appears below it with icons: crosshair/move, diamond/style, A A A (three font sizes), duplicate, delete. Dark rounded bar with icon buttons
4. **Sidebar** - Shows "GRIDS" heading with "+" button. Lists grid names with component counts (e.g., "Base Camp 12", "Night Mode 5"). Settings gear icon at top
5. **Website cards** - "Follow a snippet of a website instead of refreshing every day" - embeds live website content as a card
6. **Free-form spatial canvas** - Cards positioned freely, no grid snapping
7. **Card content types visible**: HN news feed, weather, checklists with checkboxes, image embeds, AI assistant text, book lists, system status with colored dots, navigation buttons, quote/inspiration

## Changes Needed

### 1. Visual Theme Update (style.css)
- Warm up the dark theme slightly (e.g., background from #09090b to something like #1a1a1e or #1c1917)
- Card backgrounds slightly lighter than canvas background
- Softer, warmer border colors
- Cards should have subtle rounded corners, minimal shadow

### 2. Card Header Redesign
- Each card should have a colored title with an optional icon/emoji
- Title text: bold, slightly larger, colored per-card (store color in metadata)
- Small action icon (pin/settings/grip) in top-right
- Add `title_color` and `icon` fields to component metadata

### 3. Floating Toolbar (replaces right-click context menu for components)
- When a component is clicked/selected, show a floating dark toolbar below it
- Toolbar icons: Move (crosshair), Style (diamond - opens color picker for title), Font size (A A A - cycle through sizes), Duplicate, Delete
- Toolbar follows the component, dismisses on click-away
- Keep the canvas background right-click context menu for adding new widgets

### 4. Website Card Widget (new widget type)
- New widget: `website_widget.rb` with `widget_type 'website'`
- Metadata: `{ url: "...", selector: "..." (optional CSS selector), refresh_interval: 3600 }`
- Server-side: fetch URL, extract content (optionally via CSS selector), cache rendered HTML
- Client-side: display the fetched snippet, auto-refresh on interval
- Refreshable widget that re-fetches periodically
- Uses ApplicationClient or Net::HTTP to fetch the page

### 5. Sidebar Enhancement
- Show canvas/grid count next to each page name (count of canvas_components)
- Add "+" button at top to create new canvas
- Show "GRIDS" or "CANVASES" heading
- Style to match Nova's sidebar: clean, dark, with count badges

### 6. Canvas Context Menu Update
- Keep right-click on background for "Add widget" submenu
- Remove component-specific items from context menu (moved to floating toolbar)
- Add "Scroll Lock" and "Edit Lock" toggles
- Add "Reset View" option

### 7. Component Selection State
- Click on a component to "select" it (show selection border + floating toolbar)
- Click away to deselect
- Selected state: subtle green/accent border glow

## Implementation Order

1. Visual theme update (CSS only, low risk)
2. Card header redesign (CSS + metadata + widget rendering)
3. Component selection state (JS)
4. Floating toolbar (JS + CSS, replaces component context menu)
5. Sidebar enhancement (ERB + CSS)
6. Website card widget (new Ruby widget + JS + route)
7. Canvas context menu cleanup

## Files to Modify

- `web/public/css/style.css` - Theme + card + toolbar + sidebar styles
- `web/public/js/controllers/canvas_controller.js` - Selection state, floating toolbar, context menu changes
- `web/views/layout.erb` - Sidebar redesign
- `fang/widgets/base_widget.rb` - Add header rendering with color/icon support
- `fang/widgets/*.rb` - Update existing widgets to provide default colors/icons
- `fang/models/canvas_component.rb` - Helper for metadata access (title_color, icon)
- `web/app.rb` - Route for website card proxy/fetch
- NEW: `fang/widgets/website_widget.rb` - Website snippet widget
- NEW: `web/public/js/widgets/website.js` - Client-side refresh behavior

Please provide a detailed, step-by-step implementation plan covering all these changes.
