- Title text: bold, slightly larger, colored per-card (store color in metadata)
- Small action icon (pin/settings/grip) in top-right
- Add `title_color` and `icon` fields to component metadata

### 3. Floating Toolbar (replaces right-click context menu for components)
- When a component is clicked/selected, show a floating dark toolbar below it
- Toolbar icons: Move (crosshair), Style (diamond - opens color picker for title), Font size (A A A - cycle through sizes), Duplicate, Delete
- Toolbar follows the component, dismisses on click-away
- Keep the canvas background right-click context menu for adding new widgets

### 4. Website Card Widget (new widget type)
- New widget: `website_widget.rb` with `widget_type 'website'`
- Metadata: `{ url: "...", selector: "..." (optional CSS selector), refresh_interval: 3600 }`
- Server-side: fetch URL, extract content (optionally via CSS selector), cache rendered HTML
- Client-side: display the fetched snippet, auto-refresh on interval
- Refreshable widget that re-fetches periodically
- Uses ApplicationClient or Net::HTTP to fetch the page

### 5. Sidebar Enhancement
- Show canvas/grid count next to each page name (count of canvas_components)
- Add "+" button at top to create new canvas
- Show "GRIDS" or "CANVASES" heading
- Style to match Nova's sidebar: clean, dark, with count badges

### 6. Canvas Context Menu Update
- Keep right-click on background for "Add widget" submenu
- Remove component-specific items from context menu (moved to floating toolbar)
- Add "Scroll Lock" and "Edit Lock" toggles
- Add "Reset View" option

### 7. Component Selection State
- Click on a component to "select" it (show selection border + floating toolbar)
- Click away to deselect
- Selected state: subtle green/accent border glow

## Implementation Order

1. Visual theme update (CSS only, low risk)
2. Card header redesign (CSS + metadata + widget rendering)
3. Component selection state (JS)
4. Floating toolbar (JS + CSS, replaces component context menu)
5. Sidebar enhancement (ERB + CSS)
6. Website card widget (new Ruby widget + JS + route)
7. Canvas context menu cleanup

## Files to Modify

- `web/public/css/style.css` - Theme + card + toolbar + sidebar styles
- `web/public/js/controllers/canvas_controller.js` - Selection state, floating toolbar, context menu changes
- `web/views/layout.erb` - Sidebar redesign
- `fang/widgets/base_widget.rb` - Add header rendering with color/icon support
- `fang/widgets/*.rb` - Update existing widgets to provide default colors/icons
- `fang/models/canvas_component.rb` - Helper for metadata access (title_color, icon)
- `web/app.rb` - Route for website card proxy/fetch
- NEW: `fang/widgets/website_widget.rb` - Website snippet widget
- NEW: `web/public/js/widgets/website.js` - Client-side refresh behavior

Please provide a detailed, step-by-step implementation plan covering all these changes.

Design an implementation plan to transform the OpenFang canvas UI to match the look and feel of the Nova app (nova.lightmode.io) while keeping the terminal chat at the bottom.

## Current State

OpenFang already has:
- A canvas system with pan/zoom/drag in `web/public/js/controllers/canvas_controller.js`
- Widget system with auto-discovery in `fang/widgets/base_widget.rb`
- Canvas components model in `fang/models/canvas_component.rb` (has x, y, width, height, z_index, metadata JSON, component_type, content)
- Context menu in `canvas_controller.js` with right-click to add widgets, delete, duplicate
- Chat footer with canvas tabs at bottom in `web/public/js/controllers/chat_footer_controller.js`
- CSS design system in `web/public/css/style.css` with CSS custom properties
- Multiple widget types: card/note, clock, chart, metric, list, banner, weather, data_table, etc.
- Sidebar nav in `web/views/layout.erb` listing pages
- Routes in `web/app.rb` for canvas API

## What Nova Looks Like (from screenshots)

1. **Dark warm theme** - Not pure black, slightly warm dark background. Cards are darker than background with subtle borders
2. **Card headers** - Colored title text (red for NEWS, teal for WEATHER, amber for MORNING ROUTINE, green for FOOD TRACKER). Small emoji/icon before title. Title text is bold, uppercase, colored. Small pin/settings icon in top-right corner of cards
3. **Floating toolbar on card selection** (second screenshot) - When a card is selected, a small floating toolbar appears below it with icons: crosshair/move, diamond/style, A A A (three font sizes), duplicate, delete. Dark rounded bar with icon buttons
4. **Sidebar** - Shows "GRIDS" heading with "+" button. Lists grid names with component counts (e.g., "Base Camp 12", "Night Mode 5"). Settings gear icon at top
5. **Website cards** - "Follow a snippet of a website instead of refreshing every day" - embeds live website content as a card
6. **Free-form spatial canvas** - Cards positioned freely, no grid snapping
7. **Card content types visible**: HN news feed, weather, checklists with checkboxes, image embeds, AI assistant text, book lists, system status with colored dots, navigation buttons, quote/inspiration

## Changes Needed

### 1. Visual Theme Update (style.css)
- Warm up the dark theme slightly (e.g., background from #09090b to something like #1a1a1e or #1c1917)
- Card backgrounds slightly lighter than canvas background
- Softer, warmer border colors
- Cards should have subtle rounded corners, minimal shadow

### 2. Card Header Redesign
- Each card should have a colored title with an optional icon/emoji
- Title text: bold, slightly larger, colored per-card (store color in metadata)
- Small action icon (pin/settings/grip) in top-right
- Add `title_color` and `icon` fields to component metadata

### 3. Floating Toolbar (replaces right-click context menu for components)
- When a component is clicked/selected, show a floating dark toolbar below it
- Toolbar icons: Move (crosshair), Style (diamond - opens color picker for title), Font size (A A A - cycle through sizes), Duplicate, Delete
- Toolbar follows the component, dismisses on click-away
- Keep the canvas background right-click context menu for adding new widgets

### 4. Website Card Widget (new widget type)
- New widget: `website_widget.rb` with `widget_type 'website'`
- Metadata: `{ url: "...", selector: "..." (optional CSS selector), refresh_interval: 3600 }`
- Server-side: fetch URL, extract content (optionally via CSS selector), cache rendered HTML
- Client-side: display the fetched snippet, auto-refresh on interval
- Refreshable widget that re-fetches periodically
- Uses ApplicationClient or Net::HTTP to fetch the page

### 5. Sidebar Enhancement
- Show canvas/grid count next to each page name (count of canvas_components)
- Add "+" button at top to create new canvas
- Show "GRIDS" or "CANVASES" heading
- Style to match Nova's sidebar: clean, dark, with count badges

### 6. Canvas Context Menu Update
- Keep right-click on background for "Add widget" submenu
- Remove component-specific items from context menu (moved to floating toolbar)
- Add "Scroll Lock" and "Edit Lock" toggles
- Add "Reset View" option

### 7. Component Selection State
- Click on a component to "select" it (show selection border + floating toolbar)
- Click away to deselect
- Selected state: subtle green/accent border glow

## Implementation Order

1. Visual theme update (CSS only, low risk)
2. Card header redesign (CSS + metadata + widget rendering)
3. Component selection state (JS)
4. Floating toolbar (JS + CSS, replaces component context menu)
5. Sidebar enhancement (ERB + CSS)
6. Website card widget (new Ruby widget + JS + route)
7. Canvas context menu cleanup

## Files to Modify

- `web/public/css/style.css` - Theme + card + toolbar + sidebar styles
- `web/public/js/controllers/canvas_controller.js` - Selection state, floating toolbar, context menu changes
- `web/views/layout.erb` - Sidebar redesign
- `fang/widgets/base_widget.rb` - Add header rendering with color/icon support
- `fang/widgets/*.rb` - Update existing widgets to provide default colors/icons
- `fang/models/canvas_component.rb` - Helper for metadata access (title_color, icon)
- `web/app.rb` - Route for website card proxy/fetch
- NEW: `fang/widgets/website_widget.rb` - Website snippet widget
- NEW: `web/public/js/widgets/website.js` - Client-side refresh behavior

Please provide a detailed, step-by-step implementation plan covering all these changes.

1# frozen_string_literal: true 2 3require 'net/http' 4require 'json' 5 6module Fang 7 module Widgets 8 class HackerNewsWidget < BaseWidget 9 widget_type 'hacker_news' 10 menu_label 'Add HN Feed' 11 menu_icon "\u{1F4F0}" 12 13 def self.refreshable? = true 14 def self.refresh_interval = 3600 # 1 hour 15 def self.default_metadata = { 'count' => 5 } 16 17 def render_content 18 stories = @metadata['stories'] 19 count = @metadata['count'] || 5 20 21 unless stories 22 return <<~HTML 23
24
Hacker News
25
Loading top stories...
26
27 HTML 28 end 29 30 items = stories.first(count).map do |s| 31 link = s['url'] ? %(#{s['title']}) : s['title'] 32 %(
  • #{link} (#{s['score']} pts)
    • ) 33 end.join("\n") 34 35 <<~HTML 36
    37
    Hacker News
    38
      39 #{items} 40
    41
    42 HTML 43 end 44 45 def refresh_data! 46 count = @metadata['count'] || 5 47 uri = URI('https://hacker-news.firebaseio.com/v0/topstories.json') 48 response = Net::HTTP.get(uri) 49 story_ids = JSON.parse(response).first(count) 50 51 stories = story_ids.map do |id| 52 story_uri = URI("https://hacker-news.firebaseio.com/v0/item/#{id}.json") 53 story_data = JSON.parse(Net::HTTP.get(story_uri)) 54 { 55 'title' => story_data['title'], 56 'url' => story_data['url'], 57 'score' => story_data['score'] 58 } 59 end 60 61 new_meta = @metadata.merge('stories' => stories) 62 if new_meta != @metadata 63 @component.update!(metadata: new_meta, content: self.class.new(@component.tap { |c| c.metadata = new_meta }).render_content) 64 @metadata = new_meta 65 true 66 else 67 false 68 end 69 rescue => e 70 Fang.logger.error "HN widget refresh failed: #{e.message}" 71 false 72 end 73 end 74 end 75end 76

2. **Card headers** - Colored title text (red for NEWS, teal for WEATHER, amber for MORNING ROUTINE, green for FOOD TRACKER). Small emoji/icon before title. Title text is bold, uppercase, colored. Small pin/settings icon in top-right corner of cards
3. **Floating toolbar on card selection** (second screenshot) - When a card is selected, a small floating toolbar appears below it with icons: crosshair/move, diamond/style, A A A (three font sizes), duplicate, delete. Dark rounded bar with icon buttons
4. **Sidebar** - Shows "GRIDS" heading with "+" button. Lists grid names with component counts (e.g., "Base Camp 12", "Night Mode 5"). Settings gear icon at top
5. **Website cards** - "Follow a snippet of a website instead of refreshing every day" - embeds live website content as a card
6. **Free-form spatial canvas** - Cards positioned freely, no grid snapping
7. **Card content types visible**: HN news feed, weather, checklists with checkboxes, image embeds, AI assistant text, book lists, system status with colored dots, navigation buttons, quote/inspiration

## Changes Needed

### 1. Visual Theme Update (style.css)
- Warm up the dark theme slightly (e.g., background from #09090b to something like #1a1a1e or #1c1917)
- Card backgrounds slightly lighter than canvas background
- Softer, warmer border colors
- Cards should have subtle rounded corners, minimal shadow

### 2. Card Header Redesign
- Each card should have a colored title with an optional icon/emoji
- Title text: bold, slightly larger, colored per-card (store color in metadata)
- Small action icon (pin/settings/grip) in top-right
- Add `title_color` and `icon` fields to component metadata

### 3. Floating Toolbar (replaces right-click context menu for components)
- When a component is clicked/selected, show a floating dark toolbar below it
- Toolbar icons: Move (crosshair), Style (diamond - opens color picker for title), Font size (A A A - cycle through sizes), Duplicate, Delete
- Toolbar follows the component, dismisses on click-away
- Keep the canvas background right-click context menu for adding new widgets

### 4. Website Card Widget (new widget type)
- New widget: `website_widget.rb` with `widget_type 'website'`
- Metadata: `{ url: "...", selector: "..." (optional CSS selector), refresh_interval: 3600 }`
- Server-side: fetch URL, extract content (optionally via CSS selector), cache rendered HTML
- Client-side: display the fetched snippet, auto-refresh on interval
- Refreshable widget that re-fetches periodically
- Uses ApplicationClient or Net::HTTP to fetch the page

### 5. Sidebar Enhancement
- Show canvas/grid count next to each page name (count of canvas_components)
- Add "+" button at top to create new canvas
- Show "GRIDS" or "CANVASES" heading
- Style to match Nova's sidebar: clean, dark, with count badges

### 6. Canvas Context Menu Update
- Keep right-click on background for "Add widget" submenu
- Remove component-specific items from context menu (moved to floating toolbar)
- Add "Scroll Lock" and "Edit Lock" toggles
- Add "Reset View" option

### 7. Component Selection State
- Click on a component to "select" it (show selection border + floating toolbar)
- Click away to deselect
- Selected state: subtle green/accent border glow

## Implementation Order

1. Visual theme update (CSS only, low risk)
2. Card header redesign (CSS + metadata + widget rendering)
3. Component selection state (JS)
4. Floating toolbar (JS + CSS, replaces component context menu)
5. Sidebar enhancement (ERB + CSS)
6. Website card widget (new Ruby widget + JS + route)
7. Canvas context menu cleanup

## Files to Modify

- `web/public/css/style.css` - Theme + card + toolbar + sidebar styles
- `web/public/js/controllers/canvas_controller.js` - Selection state, floating toolbar, context menu changes
- `web/views/layout.erb` - Sidebar redesign
- `fang/widgets/base_widget.rb` - Add header rendering with color/icon support
- `fang/widgets/*.rb` - Update existing widgets to provide default colors/icons
- `fang/models/canvas_component.rb` - Helper for metadata access (title_color, icon)
- `web/app.rb` - Route for website card proxy/fetch
- NEW: `fang/widgets/website_widget.rb` - Website snippet widget
- NEW: `web/public/js/widgets/website.js` - Client-side refresh behavior

Please provide a detailed, step-by-step implementation plan covering all these changes.

3. **Floating toolbar on card selection** (second screenshot) - When a card is selected, a small floating toolbar appears below it with icons: crosshair/move, diamond/style, A A A (three font sizes), duplicate, delete. Dark rounded bar with icon buttons
4. **Sidebar** - Shows "GRIDS" heading with "+" button. Lists grid names with component counts (e.g., "Base Camp 12", "Night Mode 5"). Settings gear icon at top
5. **Website cards** - "Follow a snippet of a website instead of refreshing every day" - embeds live website content as a card
6. **Free-form spatial canvas** - Cards positioned freely, no grid snapping
7. **Card content types visible**: HN news feed, weather, checklists with checkboxes, image embeds, AI assistant text, book lists, system status with colored dots, navigation buttons, quote/inspiration

## Changes Needed

### 1. Visual Theme Update (style.css)
- Warm up the dark theme slightly (e.g., background from #09090b to something like #1a1a1e or #1c1917)
- Card backgrounds slightly lighter than canvas background
- Softer, warmer border colors
- Cards should have subtle rounded corners, minimal shadow

### 2. Card Header Redesign
- Each card should have a colored title with an optional icon/emoji
- Title text: bold, slightly larger, colored per-card (store color in metadata)
- Small action icon (pin/settings/grip) in top-right
- Add `title_color` and `icon` fields to component metadata

### 3. Floating Toolbar (replaces right-click context menu for components)
- When a component is clicked/selected, show a floating dark toolbar below it
- Toolbar icons: Move (crosshair), Style (diamond - opens color picker for title), Font size (A A A - cycle through sizes), Duplicate, Delete
- Toolbar follows the component, dismisses on click-away
- Keep the canvas background right-click context menu for adding new widgets

### 4. Website Card Widget (new widget type)
- New widget: `website_widget.rb` with `widget_type 'website'`
- Metadata: `{ url: "...", selector: "..." (optional CSS selector), refresh_interval: 3600 }`
- Server-side: fetch URL, extract content (optionally via CSS selector), cache rendered HTML
- Client-side: display the fetched snippet, auto-refresh on interval
- Refreshable widget that re-fetches periodically
- Uses ApplicationClient or Net::HTTP to fetch the page

### 5. Sidebar Enhancement
- Show canvas/grid count next to each page name (count of canvas_components)
- Add "+" button at top to create new canvas
- Show "GRIDS" or "CANVASES" heading
- Style to match Nova's sidebar: clean, dark, with count badges

### 6. Canvas Context Menu Update
- Keep right-click on background for "Add widget" submenu
- Remove component-specific items from context menu (moved to floating toolbar)
- Add "Scroll Lock" and "Edit Lock" toggles
- Add "Reset View" option

### 7. Component Selection State
- Click on a component to "select" it (show selection border + floating toolbar)
- Click away to deselect
- Selected state: subtle green/accent border glow

## Implementation Order

1. Visual theme update (CSS only, low risk)
2. Card header redesign (CSS + metadata + widget rendering)
3. Component selection state (JS)
4. Floating toolbar (JS + CSS, replaces component context menu)
5. Sidebar enhancement (ERB + CSS)
6. Website card widget (new Ruby widget + JS + route)
7. Canvas context menu cleanup

## Files to Modify

- `web/public/css/style.css` - Theme + card + toolbar + sidebar styles
- `web/public/js/controllers/canvas_controller.js` - Selection state, floating toolbar, context menu changes
- `web/views/layout.erb` - Sidebar redesign
- `fang/widgets/base_widget.rb` - Add header rendering with color/icon support
- `fang/widgets/*.rb` - Update existing widgets to provide default colors/icons
- `fang/models/canvas_component.rb` - Helper for metadata access (title_color, icon)
- `web/app.rb` - Route for website card proxy/fetch
- NEW: `fang/widgets/website_widget.rb` - Website snippet widget
- NEW: `web/public/js/widgets/website.js` - Client-side refresh behavior

Please provide a detailed, step-by-step implementation plan covering all these changes.

Design an implementation plan to transform the OpenFang canvas UI to match the look and feel of the Nova app (nova.lightmode.io) while keeping the terminal chat at the bottom.

## Current State

OpenFang already has:
- A canvas system with pan/zoom/drag in `web/public/js/controllers/canvas_controller.js`
- Widget system with auto-discovery in `fang/widgets/base_widget.rb`
- Canvas components model in `fang/models/canvas_component.rb` (has x, y, width, height, z_index, metadata JSON, component_type, content)
- Context menu in `canvas_controller.js` with right-click to add widgets, delete, duplicate
- Chat footer with canvas tabs at bottom in `web/public/js/controllers/chat_footer_controller.js`
- CSS design system in `web/public/css/style.css` with CSS custom properties
- Multiple widget types: card/note, clock, chart, metric, list, banner, weather, data_table, etc.
- Sidebar nav in `web/views/layout.erb` listing pages
- Routes in `web/app.rb` for canvas API

## What Nova Looks Like (from screenshots)

1. **Dark warm theme** - Not pure black, slightly warm dark background. Cards are darker than background with subtle borders
2. **Card headers** - Colored title text (red for NEWS, teal for WEATHER, amber for MORNING ROUTINE, green for FOOD TRACKER). Small emoji/icon before title. Title text is bold, uppercase, colored. Small pin/settings icon in top-right corner of cards
3. **Floating toolbar on card selection** (second screenshot) - When a card is selected, a small floating toolbar appears below it with icons: crosshair/move, diamond/style, A A A (three font sizes), duplicate, delete. Dark rounded bar with icon buttons

5. **Website cards** - "Follow a snippet of a website instead of refreshing every day" - embeds live website content as a card
6. **Free-form spatial canvas** - Cards positioned freely, no grid snapping

- Card backgrounds slightly lighter than canvas background
- Softer, warmer border colors
- Cards should have subtle rounded corners, minimal shadow

### 2. Card Header Redesign
- Each card should have a colored title with an optional icon/emoji
- Title text: bold, slightly larger, colored per-card (store color in metadata)
- Small action icon (pin/settings/grip) in top-right
- Add `title_color` and `icon` fields to component metadata

### 3. Floating Toolbar (replaces right-click context menu for components)
- When a component is clicked/selected, show a floating dark toolbar below it
- Toolbar icons: Move (crosshair), Style (diamond - opens color picker for title), Font size (A A A - cycle through sizes), Duplicate, Delete
- Toolbar follows the component, dismisses on click-away
- Keep the canvas background right-click context menu for adding new widgets

### 4. Website Card Widget (new widget type)
- New widget: `website_widget.rb` with `widget_type 'website'`
- Metadata: `{ url: "...", selector: "..." (optional CSS selector), refresh_interval: 3600 }`
- Server-side: fetch URL, extract content (optionally via CSS selector), cache rendered HTML
- Client-side: display the fetched snippet, auto-refresh on interval
- Refreshable widget that re-fetches periodically
- Uses ApplicationClient or Net::HTTP to fetch the page

### 5. Sidebar Enhancement
- Show canvas/grid count next to each page name (count of canvas_components)
- Add "+" button at top to create new canvas
- Show "GRIDS" or "CANVASES" heading
- Style to match Nova's sidebar: clean, dark, with count badges

### 6. Canvas Context Menu Update
- Keep right-click on background for "Add widget" submenu
- Remove component-specific items from context menu (moved to floating toolbar)
- Add "Scroll Lock" and "Edit Lock" toggles
- Add "Reset View" option

### 7. Component Selection State
- Click on a component to "select" it (show selection border + floating toolbar)
- Click away to deselect
- Selected state: subtle green/accent border glow

## Implementation Order

1. Visual theme update (CSS only, low risk)
2. Card header redesign (CSS + metadata + widget rendering)
3. Component selection state (JS)
4. Floating toolbar (JS + CSS, replaces component context menu)
5. Sidebar enhancement (ERB + CSS)
6. Website card widget (new Ruby widget + JS + route)
7. Canvas context menu cleanup

## Files to Modify

- `web/public/css/style.css` - Theme + card + toolbar + sidebar styles
- `web/public/js/controllers/canvas_controller.js` - Selection state, floating toolbar, context menu changes
- `web/views/layout.erb` - Sidebar redesign
- `fang/widgets/base_widget.rb` - Add header rendering with color/icon support
- `fang/widgets/*.rb` - Update existing widgets to provide default colors/icons
- `fang/models/canvas_component.rb` - Helper for metadata access (title_color, icon)
- `web/app.rb` - Route for website card proxy/fetch
- NEW: `fang/widgets/website_widget.rb` - Website snippet widget
- NEW: `web/public/js/widgets/website.js` - Client-side refresh behavior

Please provide a detailed, step-by-step implementation plan covering all these changes.

25
#{city}
26
Loading weather data...

data.prompt:
Design an implementation plan to transform the OpenFang canvas UI to match the look and feel of the Nova app (nova.lightmode.io) while keeping the terminal chat at the bottom.

## Current State

OpenFang already has:
- A canvas system with pan/zoom/drag in `web/public/js/controllers/canvas_controller.js`
- Widget system with auto-discovery in `fang/widgets/base_widget.rb`
- Canvas components model in `fang/models/canvas_component.rb` (has x, y, width, height, z_index, metadata JSON, component_type, content)
- Context menu in `canvas_controller.js` with right-click to add widgets, delete, duplicate
- Chat footer with canvas tabs at bottom in `web/public/js/controllers/chat_footer_controller.js`
- CSS design system in `web/public/css/style.css` with CSS custom properties
- Multiple widget types: card/note, clock, chart, metric, list, banner, weather, data_table, etc.
- Sidebar nav in `web/views/layout.erb` listing pages
- Routes in `web/app.rb` for canvas API

## What Nova Looks Like (from screenshots)

1. **Dark warm theme** - Not pure black, slightly warm dark background. Cards are darker than background with subtle borders
2. **Card headers** - Colored title text (red for NEWS, teal for WEATHER, amber for MORNING ROUTINE, green for FOOD TRACKER). Small emoji/icon before title. Title text is bold, uppercase, colored. Small pin/settings icon in top-right corner of cards
3. **Floating toolbar on card selection** (second screenshot) - When a card is selected, a small floating toolbar appears below it with icons: crosshair/move, diamond/style, A A A (three font sizes), duplicate, delete. Dark rounded bar with icon buttons
4. **Sidebar** - Shows "GRIDS" heading with "+" button. Lists grid names with component counts (e.g., "Base Camp 12", "Night Mode 5"). Settings gear icon at top
5. **Website cards** - "Follow a snippet of a website instead of refreshing every day" - embeds live website content as a card
6. **Free-form spatial canvas** - Cards positioned freely, no grid snapping
7. **Card content types visible**: HN news feed, weather, checklists with checkboxes, image embeds, AI assistant text, book lists, system status with colored dots, navigation buttons, quote/inspiration

## Changes Needed

### 1. Visual Theme Update (style.css)
- Warm up the dark theme slightly (e.g., background from #09090b to something like #1a1a1e or #1c1917)
- Card backgrounds slightly lighter than canvas background
- Softer, warmer border colors
- Cards should have subtle rounded corners, minimal shadow

### 2. Card Header Redesign
- Each card should have a colored title with an optional icon/emoji
- Title text: bold, slightly larger, colored per-card (store color in metadata)
- Small action icon (pin/settings/grip) in top-right
- Add `title_color` and `icon` fields to component metadata

### 3. Floating Toolbar (replaces right-click context menu for components)
- When a component is clicked/selected, show a floating dark toolbar below it
- Toolbar icons: Move (crosshair), Style (diamond - opens color picker for title), Font size (A A A - cycle through sizes), Duplicate, Delete
- Toolbar follows the component, dismisses on click-away
- Keep the canvas background right-click context menu for adding new widgets

### 4. Website Card Widget (new widget type)
- New widget: `website_widget.rb` with `widget_type 'website'`
- Metadata: `{ url: "...", selector: "..." (optional CSS selector), refresh_interval: 3600 }`
- Server-side: fetch URL, extract content (optionally via CSS selector), cache rendered HTML
- Client-side: display the fetched snippet, auto-refresh on interval
- Refreshable widget that re-fetches periodically
- Uses ApplicationClient or Net::HTTP to fetch the page

### 5. Sidebar Enhancement
- Show canvas/grid count next to each page name (count of canvas_components)
- Add "+" button at top to create new canvas
- Show "GRIDS" or "CANVASES" heading
- Style to match Nova's sidebar: clean, dark, with count badges

### 6. Canvas Context Menu Update
- Keep right-click on background for "Add widget" submenu
- Remove component-specific items from context menu (moved to floating toolbar)
- Add "Scroll Lock" and "Edit Lock" toggles
- Add "Reset View" option

### 7. Component Selection State
- Click on a component to "select" it (show selection border + floating toolbar)
- Click away to deselect
- Selected state: subtle green/accent border glow

## Implementation Order

1. Visual theme update (CSS only, low risk)
2. Card header redesign (CSS + metadata + widget rendering)
3. Component selection state (JS)
4. Floating toolbar (JS + CSS, replaces component context menu)
5. Sidebar enhancement (ERB + CSS)
6. Website card widget (new Ruby widget + JS + route)
7. Canvas context menu cleanup

## Files to Modify

- `web/public/css/style.css` - Theme + card + toolbar + sidebar styles
- `web/public/js/controllers/canvas_controller.js` - Selection state, floating toolbar, context menu changes
- `web/views/layout.erb` - Sidebar redesign
- `fang/widgets/base_widget.rb` - Add header rendering with color/icon support
- `fang/widgets/*.rb` - Update existing widgets to provide default colors/icons
- `fang/models/canvas_component.rb` - Helper for metadata access (title_color, icon)
- `web/app.rb` - Route for website card proxy/fetch
- NEW: `fang/widgets/website_widget.rb` - Website snippet widget
- NEW: `web/public/js/widgets/website.js` - Client-side refresh behavior

Please provide a detailed, step-by-step implementation plan covering all these changes.

   481
   482          # Widget type registry
   483          r.on 'widget_types' do
   484            r.get do
   485              types = Fang::Widgets::BaseWidget.registry.map do |type, klass|
   486                { type: type, label: klass.menu_label_text || type.tr('_', ' ').capitalize,
   487                  icon: klass.menu_icon_text, defaults: klass.default_metadata }
   488              end
   489              { widget_types: types }

   492
   493          # Page canvas content by page ID
   494          r.on 'pages', Integer do |page_id|
   495            page = Page.find(page_id)
   496
   497            # Canvas SSE stream  one per canvas
   498            r.on 'stream' do
   499              r.get do
   500                sse_stream("canvas:#{page.id}")
   501              end
   502            end
   503
   504            r.on 'canvas' do
   505              r.get do
   506                components = page.canvas_components.ordered.map do |comp|
   507                  # Auto-render widget content if stored content is blank
   508                  if comp.content.blank?
   509                    rendered = comp.render_content_html
   510                    comp.update_column(:content, rendered) if rendered.present?
   511                  end
   512                  comp.as_canvas_json
   513                end
   514                {
   515                  components: components,
   516                  canvas_state: page.canvas_state || {}
   517                }
   518              end
   519            end
   520
   521            r.on 'components' do
   522              r.is do
   523                r.post do
   524                  raw = r.body.read
   525                  r.body.rewind
   526                  body = begin; JSON.parse(raw); rescue; r.params; end
   527                  comp_type = body['component_type'] || 'card'
   528                  metadata = body['metadata'] || {}
   529
   530                  # Merge widget default metadata
   531                  widget_class = Fang::Widgets::BaseWidget.for_type(comp_type)
   532                  metadata = widget_class.default_metadata.merge(metadata) if widget_class
   533
   534                  component = page.canvas_components.create!(
   535                    component_type: comp_type,
   536                    content: body['content'] || '',
   537                    x: body['x']&.to_f || 0,
   538                    y: body['y']&.to_f || 0,
   539                    width: body['width']&.to_f || 320,
   540                    height: body['height']&.to_f,
   541                    z_index: body['z_index']&.to_i || 0,
   542                    metadata: metadata
   543                  )
   544
   545                  # Auto-render content from widget if content is blank
   546                  if component.content.blank?
   547                    rendered = component.render_content_html
   548                    component.update_column(:content, rendered) if rendered.present?
   549                  end
   550
   551                  # Broadcast via canvas channel
   552                  html = component.render_html
   553                  turbo = "<turbo-stream action=\"append\" target=\"canvas-components-#{page.id}\"><template>#{html}</template></turbo-stream>"
   554                  TurboBroadcast.broadcast("canvas:#{page.id}", turbo)
   555
   556                  component.as_canvas_json
   557                end
   558              end
   559
   560              r.on Integer do |component_id|

   562
   563                r.get do
   564                  component.as_canvas_json
   565                end
   566
   567                r.patch do
   568                  raw = r.body.read
   569                  r.body.rewind
   570                  body = begin; JSON.parse(raw); rescue; r.params; end
   571                  updates = {}
   572                  %w[x y width height z_index].each do |attr|
   573                    updates[attr] = (body[attr] || r.params[attr]).to_f if body[attr] || r.params[attr]
   574                  end
   575                  updates[:content] = body['content'] if body.key?('content')
   576                  if body.key?('metadata')
   577                    updates[:metadata] = (component.metadata || {}).deep_merge(body['metadata'])
   578                  end
   579                  component.update!(updates) if updates.any?
   580                  component.as_canvas_json
   581                end
   582
   583                r.delete do
   584                  turbo = "<turbo-stream action=\"remove\" target=\"canvas-component-#{component.id}\"></turbo-stream>"
   585                  TurboBroadcast.broadcast("canvas:#{page.id}", turbo)
   586                  component.destroy!
   587                  { success: true }
   588                end
   589              end
   590            end
   591          end

data.prompt:
Design an implementation plan to transform the OpenFang canvas UI to match the look and feel of the Nova app (nova.lightmode.io) while keeping the terminal chat at the bottom.

## Current State

OpenFang already has:
- A canvas system with pan/zoom/drag in `web/public/js/controllers/canvas_controller.js`
- Widget system with auto-discovery in `fang/widgets/base_widget.rb`
- Canvas components model in `fang/models/canvas_component.rb` (has x, y, width, height, z_index, metadata JSON, component_type, content)
- Context menu in `canvas_controller.js` with right-click to add widgets, delete, duplicate
- Chat footer with canvas tabs at bottom in `web/public/js/controllers/chat_footer_controller.js`
- CSS design system in `web/public/css/style.css` with CSS custom properties
- Multiple widget types: card/note, clock, chart, metric, list, banner, weather, data_table, etc.
- Sidebar nav in `web/views/layout.erb` listing pages
- Routes in `web/app.rb` for canvas API

## What Nova Looks Like (from screenshots)

1. **Dark warm theme** - Not pure black, slightly warm dark background. Cards are darker than background with subtle borders
2. **Card headers** - Colored title text (red for NEWS, teal for WEATHER, amber for MORNING ROUTINE, green for FOOD TRACKER). Small emoji/icon before title. Title text is bold, uppercase, colored. Small pin/settings icon in top-right corner of cards
3. **Floating toolbar on card selection** (second screenshot) - When a card is selected, a small floating toolbar appears below it with icons: crosshair/move, diamond/style, A A A (three font sizes), duplicate, delete. Dark rounded bar with icon buttons
4. **Sidebar** - Shows "GRIDS" heading with "+" button. Lists grid names with component counts (e.g., "Base Camp 12", "Night Mode 5"). Settings gear icon at top
5. **Website cards** - "Follow a snippet of a website instead of refreshing every day" - embeds live website content as a card
6. **Free-form spatial canvas** - Cards positioned freely, no grid snapping
7. **Card content types visible**: HN news feed, weather, checklists with checkboxes, image embeds, AI assistant text, book lists, system status with colored dots, navigation buttons, quote/inspiration

## Changes Needed

### 1. Visual Theme Update (style.css)
- Warm up the dark theme slightly (e.g., background from #09090b to something like #1a1a1e or #1c1917)
- Card backgrounds slightly lighter than canvas background
- Softer, warmer border colors
- Cards should have subtle rounded corners, minimal shadow

### 2. Card Header Redesign
- Each card should have a colored title with an optional icon/emoji
- Title text: bold, slightly larger, colored per-card (store color in metadata)
- Small action icon (pin/settings/grip) in top-right
- Add `title_color` and `icon` fields to component metadata

### 3. Floating Toolbar (replaces right-click context menu for components)
- When a component is clicked/selected, show a floating dark toolbar below it
- Toolbar icons: Move (crosshair), Style (diamond - opens color picker for title), Font size (A A A - cycle through sizes), Duplicate, Delete
- Toolbar follows the component, dismisses on click-away
- Keep the canvas background right-click context menu for adding new widgets

### 4. Website Card Widget (new widget type)
- New widget: `website_widget.rb` with `widget_type 'website'`
- Metadata: `{ url: "...", selector: "..." (optional CSS selector), refresh_interval: 3600 }`
- Server-side: fetch URL, extract content (optionally via CSS selector), cache rendered HTML
- Client-side: display the fetched snippet, auto-refresh on interval
- Refreshable widget that re-fetches periodically
- Uses ApplicationClient or Net::HTTP to fetch the page

### 5. Sidebar Enhancement
- Show canvas/grid count next to each page name (count of canvas_components)
- Add "+" button at top to create new canvas
- Show "GRIDS" or "CANVASES" heading
- Style to match Nova's sidebar: clean, dark, with count badges

### 6. Canvas Context Menu Update
- Keep right-click on background for "Add widget" submenu
- Remove component-specific items from context menu (moved to floating toolbar)
- Add "Scroll Lock" and "Edit Lock" toggles
- Add "Reset View" option

### 7. Component Selection State
- Click on a component to "select" it (show selection border + floating toolbar)
- Click away to deselect
- Selected state: subtle green/accent border glow

## Implementation Order

1. Visual theme update (CSS only, low risk)
2. Card header redesign (CSS + metadata + widget rendering)
3. Component selection state (JS)
4. Floating toolbar (JS + CSS, replaces component context menu)
5. Sidebar enhancement (ERB + CSS)
6. Website card widget (new Ruby widget + JS + route)
7. Canvas context menu cleanup

## Files to Modify

- `web/public/css/style.css` - Theme + card + toolbar + sidebar styles
- `web/public/js/controllers/canvas_controller.js` - Selection state, floating toolbar, context menu changes
- `web/views/layout.erb` - Sidebar redesign
- `fang/widgets/base_widget.rb` - Add header rendering with color/icon support
- `fang/widgets/*.rb` - Update existing widgets to provide default colors/icons
- `fang/models/canvas_component.rb` - Helper for metadata access (title_color, icon)
- `web/app.rb` - Route for website card proxy/fetch
- NEW: `fang/widgets/website_widget.rb` - Website snippet widget
- NEW: `web/public/js/widgets/website.js` - Client-side refresh behavior

Please provide a detailed, step-by-step implementation plan covering all these changes.

Design an implementation plan to transform the OpenFang canvas UI to match the look and feel of the Nova app (nova.lightmode.io) while keeping the terminal chat at the bottom.

## Current State

OpenFang already has:
- A canvas system with pan/zoom/drag in `web/public/js/controllers/canvas_controller.js`
- Widget system with auto-discovery in `fang/widgets/base_widget.rb`
- Canvas components model in `fang/models/canvas_component.rb` (has x, y, width, height, z_index, metadata JSON, component_type, content)
- Context menu in `canvas_controller.js` with right-click to add widgets, delete, duplicate
- Chat footer with canvas tabs at bottom in `web/public/js/controllers/chat_footer_controller.js`
- CSS design system in `web/public/css/style.css` with CSS custom properties
- Multiple widget types: card/note, clock, chart, metric, list, banner, weather, data_table, etc.
- Sidebar nav in `web/views/layout.erb` listing pages
- Routes in `web/app.rb` for canvas API

## What Nova Looks Like (from screenshots)

1. **Dark warm theme** - Not pure black, slightly warm dark background. Cards are darker than background with subtle borders
2. **Card headers** - Colored title text (red for NEWS, teal for WEATHER, amber for MORNING ROUTINE, green for FOOD TRACKER). Small emoji/icon before title. Title text is bold, uppercase, colored. Small pin/settings icon in top-right corner of cards
3. **Floating toolbar on card selection** (second screenshot) - When a card is selected, a small floating toolbar appears below it with icons: crosshair/move, diamond/style, A A A (three font sizes), duplicate, delete. Dark rounded bar with icon buttons
4. **Sidebar** - Shows "GRIDS" heading with "+" button. Lists grid names with component counts (e.g., "Base Camp 12", "Night Mode 5"). Settings gear icon at top
5. **Website cards** - "Follow a snippet of a website instead of refreshing every day" - embeds live website content as a card
6. **Free-form spatial canvas** - Cards positioned freely, no grid snapping
7. **Card content types visible**: HN news feed, weather, checklists with checkboxes, image embeds, AI assistant text, book lists, system status with colored dots, navigation buttons, quote/inspiration

## Changes Needed

### 1. Visual Theme Update (style.css)
- Warm up the dark theme slightly (e.g., background from #09090b to something like #1a1a1e or #1c1917)
- Card backgrounds slightly lighter than canvas background
- Softer, warmer border colors
- Cards should have subtle rounded corners, minimal shadow

### 2. Card Header Redesign
- Each card should have a colored title with an optional icon/emoji
- Title text: bold, slightly larger, colored per-card (store color in metadata)
- Small action icon (pin/settings/grip) in top-right
- Add `title_color` and `icon` fields to component metadata

### 3. Floating Toolbar (replaces right-click context menu for components)
- When a component is clicked/selected, show a floating dark toolbar below it
- Toolbar icons: Move (crosshair), Style (diamond - opens color picker for title), Font size (A A A - cycle through sizes), Duplicate, Delete
- Toolbar follows the component, dismisses on click-away
- Keep the canvas background right-click context menu for adding new widgets

### 4. Website Card Widget (new widget type)
- New widget: `website_widget.rb` with `widget_type 'website'`
- Metadata: `{ url: "...", selector: "..." (optional CSS selector), refresh_interval: 3600 }`
- Server-side: fetch URL, extract content (optionally via CSS selector), cache rendered HTML
- Client-side: display the fetched snippet, auto-refresh on interval
- Refreshable widget that re-fetches periodically
- Uses ApplicationClient or Net::HTTP to fetch the page

### 5. Sidebar Enhancement
- Show canvas/grid count next to each page name (count of canvas_components)
- Add "+" button at top to create new canvas
- Show "GRIDS" or "CANVASES" heading
- Style to match Nova's sidebar: clean, dark, with count badges

### 6. Canvas Context Menu Update
- Keep right-click on background for "Add widget" submenu
- Remove component-specific items from context menu (moved to floating toolbar)
- Add "Scroll Lock" and "Edit Lock" toggles
- Add "Reset View" option

### 7. Component Selection State
- Click on a component to "select" it (show selection border + floating toolbar)
- Click away to deselect
- Selected state: subtle green/accent border glow

## Implementation Order

1. Visual theme update (CSS only, low risk)
2. Card header redesign (CSS + metadata + widget rendering)
3. Component selection state (JS)
4. Floating toolbar (JS + CSS, replaces component context menu)
5. Sidebar enhancement (ERB + CSS)
6. Website card widget (new Ruby widget + JS + route)
7. Canvas context menu cleanup

## Files to Modify

- `web/public/css/style.css` - Theme + card + toolbar + sidebar styles
- `web/public/js/controllers/canvas_controller.js` - Selection state, floating toolbar, context menu changes
- `web/views/layout.erb` - Sidebar redesign
- `fang/widgets/base_widget.rb` - Add header rendering with color/icon support
- `fang/widgets/*.rb` - Update existing widgets to provide default colors/icons
- `fang/models/canvas_component.rb` - Helper for metadata access (title_color, icon)
- `web/app.rb` - Route for website card proxy/fetch
- NEW: `fang/widgets/website_widget.rb` - Website snippet widget
- NEW: `web/public/js/widgets/website.js` - Client-side refresh behavior

Please provide a detailed, step-by-step implementation plan covering all these changes.

# frozen_string_literal: true module Fang module Widgets class BaseWidget class << self attr_reader :widget_type_name, :menu_label_text, :menu_icon_text def widget_type(name) = @widget_type_name = name.to_s def menu_label(label) = @menu_label_text = label def menu_icon(icon) = @menu_icon_text = icon def refreshable? = false def refresh_interval = nil def default_metadata = {} def registry @registry ||= ObjectSpace.each_object(Class) .select { |c| c < BaseWidget && c.widget_type_name } .each_with_object({}) { |c, h| h[c.widget_type_name] = c } end def reset_registry! = @registry = nil def for_type(type) = registry[type.to_s] end def initialize(component) @component = component @metadata = component.metadata || {} end def render_content @component.content || '' end def render_component_html c = @component style = "left:#{c.x}px;top:#{c.y}px;width:#{c.width}px;" style += "height:#{c.height}px;" if c.height meta_json = (@metadata || {}).to_json.gsub('"', '"') <<~HTML
#{render_content}
HTML end def refresh_data! false end private def evaluate_data_source source = @metadata['data_source'] return nil unless source.is_a?(String) && !source.empty? ctx = Object.new Fang.constants.map { |c| Fang.const_get(c) } .select { |c| c.is_a?(Class) && c < ActiveRecord::Base } .each { |model| ctx.define_singleton_method(model.name.demodulize.to_sym) { model } } ctx.instance_eval(source) rescue => e Fang.logger.error "Data source evaluation failed: #{e.message}" nil end def h(text) Rack::Utils.escape_html(text.to_s) end end end end

# frozen_string_literal: true require 'net/http' require 'json' module Fang module Widgets class WeatherWidget < BaseWidget widget_type 'weather' menu_label 'Add Weather' menu_icon "\u{2600}\u{FE0F}" def self.refreshable? = true def self.refresh_interval = 1800 # 30 minutes def self.default_metadata = { 'city' => 'Zurich', 'country' => 'CH' } def render_content city = @metadata['city'] || 'Zurich' temp = @metadata['temp_c'] desc = @metadata['description'] unless temp return <<~HTML
#{city}
Loading weather data...
HTML end feels = @metadata['feels_like_c'] humidity = @metadata['humidity'] wind = @metadata['wind_kmph'] wind_dir = @metadata['wind_dir'] <<~HTML
#{city}
#{desc}
\u{2600}\u{FE0F}
#{temp}\u00B0C Feels like #{feels}\u00B0
Humidity
#{humidity}%
Wind
#{wind} km/h
Direction
#{wind_dir}
HTML end def refresh_data! city = @metadata['city'] || 'Zurich' uri = URI("https://wttr.in/#{URI.encode_www_form_component(city)}?format=j1") response = Net::HTTP.get(uri) data = JSON.parse(response) current = data['current_condition']&.first || {} new_meta = @metadata.merge( 'temp_c' => current['temp_C'], 'feels_like_c' => current['FeelsLikeC'], 'humidity' => current['humidity'], 'description' => current.dig('weatherDesc', 0, 'value'), 'wind_kmph' => current['windspeedKmph'], 'wind_dir' => current['winddir16Point'] ) if new_meta != @metadata @component.update!(metadata: new_meta, content: self.class.new(@component.tap { |c| c.metadata = new_meta }).render_content) @metadata = new_meta true else false end rescue => e Fang.logger.error "Weather widget refresh failed: #{e.message}" false end end end end

# Nova-Style Canvas Redesign ## Context Transform OpenFang's canvas UI to match Nova's (nova.lightmode.io) aesthetic and interaction patterns warm dark theme, colored card headers, floating component toolbar, website snippet cards while keeping OpenFang's terminal chat footer and existing widget system. ## 1. Warm Dark Theme **File:** `web/public/css/style.css` (lines 46-68, dark mode tokens) Update dark mode CSS custom properties: ``` --background: #1a1a1e (warm dark, was #09090b) --card: #242428 (slightly lighter, was #18181b) --muted: #2e2e33 (was #27272a) --border: #3a3a40 (warmer, was #27272a) --muted-foreground: #9a9aaa ``` Also update canvas dot grid color to match warmer palette. ## 2. Card Header System **Files:** `fang/widgets/base_widget.rb`, all widget files Add a card header bar to `render_component_html` in `BaseWidget`: - Renders a `.canvas-component-header` div above `.canvas-component-content` - Shows colored title text + optional icon from metadata (`title`, `title_color`, `icon`) - Each widget provides default `header_title`, `header_color`, `header_icon` class methods - Small grip/drag handle icon on the right side of header (for dragging) Widget defaults: | Widget | Color | Icon (SVG) | Title | |--------|-------|------------|-------| | card/note | `#a1a1aa` | doc | (from metadata or "Note") | | weather | `#38bdf8` | sun | "Weather" | | clock | `#c084fc` | clock | "Clock" | | chart | `#f97316` | chart | "Chart" | | metric | `#22d3ee` | trending | (from metadata) | | list | `#a78bfa` | list | (from metadata) | | hacker_news | `#f97316` | newspaper | "News" | | website | `#60a5fa` | globe | (from metadata) | **CSS additions** in `style.css`: ```css .canvas-component-header { display: flex; align-items: center; gap: 0.375rem; padding: 0.5rem 0.75rem; font-size: 0.7rem; font-weight: 700; letter-spacing: 0.05em; text-transform: uppercase; border-bottom: 1px solid var(--border); cursor: grab; } .canvas-component-header .header-icon { width: 14px; height: 14px; } .canvas-component-header .header-grip { margin-left: auto; opacity: 0; transition: opacity 0.15s; } .canvas-component:hover .header-grip { opacity: 0.5; } ``` Reduce `.canvas-component-content` padding slightly to `0.75rem`. ## 3. Floating Component Toolbar **Files:** `web/public/js/controllers/canvas_controller.js`, `web/public/css/style.css` Replace the right-click component context menu with a floating toolbar that appears when a component is clicked/selected. **Selection behavior:** - Click a component add `.selected` class, show toolbar below it - Click canvas background or another component deselect previous - Toolbar positioned absolutely relative to canvas world, centered below the selected component **Toolbar HTML** (created dynamically in JS): ```html
``` **Toolbar actions:** - **Move** visual indicator that drag is active (already works via header/component drag) - **Style** opens a small color picker popover (6-8 preset colors) for `title_color` - **A A A** cycles component font size (small/medium/large, stored in metadata `font_size`) - **Duplicate** same as current context menu duplicate logic - **Delete** same as current context menu delete logic **CSS:** ```css .canvas-component-toolbar { position: absolute; display: flex; align-items: center; gap: 2px; background: #1a1a1e; border: 1px solid var(--border); border-radius: var(--radius-lg); padding: 0.25rem; box-shadow: var(--shadow-lg); z-index: 100; } .canvas-component.selected { border-color: var(--primary); box-shadow: 0 0 0 2px color-mix(in srgb, var(--primary) 20%, transparent); } ``` Keep the right-click context menu for the canvas background (adding widgets, scroll/edit lock, reset view). ## 4. Website Card Widget (new) **New files:** - `fang/widgets/website_widget.rb` - `web/public/js/widgets/website.js` **Widget behavior:** - `widget_type 'website'`, `menu_label 'Add Website'`, `menu_icon` globe SVG - `refreshable? = true`, `refresh_interval = 3600` (1 hour) - Metadata: `{ url:, selector: (optional CSS selector), title: }` - `refresh_data!` fetches URL via `Net::HTTP`, parses HTML with Nokogiri (or basic regex extraction), extracts content within `selector` or full page body, sanitizes HTML, stores as `content` - Renders: header "WEBSITE" with globe icon, then the fetched snippet content below, with a small footer showing the source URL and last-fetched timestamp **Route addition** in `web/app.rb`: - No new route needed uses existing `POST /api/pages/:id/components` and `PATCH` for metadata updates - Widget refresh handled by existing `ScheduledTaskRunnerJob` / widget refresh system **Client-side** (`website.js`): - Register widget behavior that shows a URL + optional CSS selector input when first created (empty state) - On URL submit, PATCHes component metadata, triggers server-side refresh ## 5. Sidebar Enhancement **File:** `web/views/layout.erb` (lines 57-68) Redesign sidebar to match Nova's grid listing: - Add "CANVASES" heading with `+` button (creates new canvas via existing `POST /api/canvases`) - Show component count badge next to each page name: `Page.title` + `page.canvas_components.count` - Active canvas gets highlighted background - Slightly larger font, more padding between items ```erb
CANVASES
<% Fang::Page.published.recent.each do |page| %> <%= page.title %> <%= page.canvas_components.count %> <% end %>
``` **CSS additions:** ```css .sidebar-heading { font-size: 0.7rem; font-weight: 600; letter-spacing: 0.08em; text-transform: uppercase; color: var(--muted-foreground); } .sidebar-count { font-size: 0.75rem; color: var(--muted-foreground); min-width: 1.5rem; text-align: right; } .sidebar-link { display: flex; justify-content: space-between; align-items: center; } ``` ## 6. Minor Canvas Interaction Polish **File:** `web/public/js/controllers/canvas_controller.js` - Double-click on empty canvas opens context menu (add widget) at that position - Smoother pan with `will-change: transform` on `.canvas-world` ## Files to Modify | File | Changes | |------|---------| | `web/public/css/style.css` | Warm theme tokens, card header, toolbar, selection, sidebar styles | | `fang/widgets/base_widget.rb` | Add header rendering to `render_component_html`, header class methods | | `fang/widgets/note_widget.rb` | Add `header_color`, `header_icon`, `header_title` defaults | | `fang/widgets/weather_widget.rb` | Same header defaults | | `fang/widgets/clock_widget.rb` | Same | | `fang/widgets/chart_widget.rb` | Same | | `fang/widgets/metric_widget.rb` | Same | | `fang/widgets/list_widget.rb` | Same | | `fang/widgets/hacker_news_widget.rb` | Same | | `web/public/js/controllers/canvas_controller.js` | Selection state, floating toolbar, color picker, font size, double-click | | `web/views/layout.erb` | Sidebar redesign with headings + counts | | **NEW** `fang/widgets/website_widget.rb` | Website snippet widget | | **NEW** `web/public/js/widgets/website.js` | Client-side behavior for website widget | ## Implementation Order 1. Warm dark theme (CSS tokens only zero risk) 2. Card header system (BaseWidget + widget defaults + CSS) 3. Component selection state + floating toolbar (JS + CSS) 4. Sidebar enhancement (ERB + CSS) 5. Website card widget (new Ruby + JS files) 6. Polish & interaction tweaks ## Verification 1. Start server with `./openfang.rb server` 2. Open browser to localhost:3000 3. Create a new canvas via "+" button 4. Right-click canvas add Note, Weather, Clock widgets 5. Verify: warm dark theme, colored card headers, dot grid background 6. Click a component floating toolbar appears below it 7. Test toolbar: change color, cycle font size, duplicate, delete 8. Right-click canvas background context menu still works for adding widgets 9. Add a Website widget enter a URL verify it fetches and displays snippet 10. Check sidebar shows canvas names with component counts

Website Card Widget (new) **New files:** - `fang/widgets/website_widget.rb` - `web/public/js/widgets/website.js` **Widget behavior:** - `widget_type 'website'`, `menu_label 'Add Website'`, `menu_icon` globe SVG - `refreshable? = true`, `refresh_interval = 3600` (1 hour) - Metadata: `{ url:, selector: (optional CSS selector), title: }` - `refresh_data!` fetches URL via `Net::HTTP`, parses HTML with Nokogiri (or basic regex extraction), extracts content within `selector` or full page body, sanitizes HTML, stores as `content` - Renders: header "WEBSITE" with globe icon, then the fetched snippet content below, with a small footer showing the source URL and last-fetched timestamp **Route addition** in `web/app.rb`: - No new route needed uses existing `POST /api/pages/:id/components` and `PATCH` for metadata updates - Widget refresh handled by existing `ScheduledTaskRunnerJob` / widget refresh system **Client-side** (`website.js`): - Register widget behavior that shows a URL + optional CSS selector input when first created (empty state) - On URL submit, PATCHes component metadata, triggers server-side refresh ## 5. Sidebar Enhancement **File:** `web/views/layout.erb` (lines 57-68) Redesign sidebar to match Nova's grid listing: - Add "CANVASES" heading with `+` button (creates new canvas via existing `POST /api/canvases`) - Show component count badge next to each page name: `Page.title` + `page.canvas_components.count` - Active canvas gets highlighted background - Slightly larger font, more padding between items ```erb
CANVASES
<% Fang::Page.published.recent.each do |page| %> <%= page.title %> <%= page.canvas_components.count %> <% end %>
``` **CSS additions:** ```css .sidebar-heading { font-size: 0.7rem; font-weight: 600; letter-spacing: 0.08em; text-transform: uppercase; color: var(--muted-foreground); } .sidebar-count { font-size: 0.75rem; color: var(--muted-foreground); min-width: 1.5rem; text-align: right; } .sidebar-link { display: flex; justify-content: space-between; align-items: center; } ``` ## 6. Minor Canvas Interaction Polish **File:** `web/public/js/controllers/canvas_controller.js` - Double-click on empty canvas opens context menu (add widget) at that position - Smoother pan with `will-change: transform` on `.canvas-world` ## Files to Modify | File | Changes | |------|---------| | `web/public/css/style.css` | Warm theme tokens, card header, toolbar, selection, sidebar styles | | `fang/widgets/base_widget.rb` | Add header rendering to `render_component_html`, header class methods | | `fang/widgets/note_widget.rb` | Add `header_color`, `header_icon`, `header_title` defaults | | `fang/widgets/weather_widget.rb` | Same header defaults | | `fang/widgets/clock_widget.rb` | Same | | `fang/widgets/chart_widget.rb` | Same | | `fang/widgets/metric_widget.rb` | Same | | `fang/widgets/list_widget.rb` | Same | | `fang/widgets/hacker_news_widget.rb` | Same | | `web/public/js/controllers/canvas_controller.js` | Selection state, floating toolbar, color picker, font size, double-click | | `web/views/layout.erb` | Sidebar redesign with headings + counts | | **NEW** `fang/widgets/website_widget.rb` | Website snippet widget | | **NEW** `web/public/js/widgets/website.js` | Client-side behavior for website widget | ## Implementation Order 1. Warm dark theme (CSS tokens only zero risk) 2. Card header system (BaseWidget + widget defaults + CSS) 3. Component selection state + floating toolbar (JS + CSS) 4. Sidebar enhancement (ERB + CSS) 5. Website card widget (new Ruby + JS files) 6. Polish & interaction tweaks ## Verification 1. Start server with `./openfang.rb server` 2. Open browser to localhost:3000 3. Create a new canvas via "+" button 4. Right-click canvas add Note, Weather, Clock widgets 5. Verify: warm dark theme, colored card headers, dot grid background 6. Click a component floating toolbar appears below it 7. Test toolbar: change color, cycle font size, duplicate, delete 8. Right-click canvas background context menu still works for adding widgets 9. Add a Website widget enter a URL verify it fetches and displays snippet 10. Check sidebar shows canvas names with component counts

# Nova-Style Canvas Redesign ## Context Transform OpenFang's canvas UI to match Nova's (nova.lightmode.io) aesthetic and interaction patterns warm dark theme, colored card headers, floating component toolbar, website snippet cards while keeping OpenFang's terminal chat footer and existing widget system. ## 1. Warm Dark Theme **File:** `web/public/css/style.css` (lines 46-68, dark mode tokens) Update dark mode CSS custom properties: ``` --background: #1a1a1e (warm dark, was #09090b) --card: #242428 (slightly lighter, was #18181b) --muted: #2e2e33 (was #27272a) --border: #3a3a40 (warmer, was #27272a) --muted-foreground: #9a9aaa ``` Also update canvas dot grid color to match warmer palette. ## 2. Card Header System **Files:** `fang/widgets/base_widget.rb`, all widget files Add a card header bar to `render_component_html` in `BaseWidget`: - Renders a `.canvas-component-header` div above `.canvas-component-content` - Shows colored title text + optional icon from metadata (`title`, `title_color`, `icon`) - Each widget provides default `header_title`, `header_color`, `header_icon` class methods - Small grip/drag handle icon on the right side of header (for dragging) Widget defaults: | Widget | Color | Icon (SVG) | Title | |--------|-------|------------|-------| | card/note | `#a1a1aa` | doc | (from metadata or "Note") | | weather | `#38bdf8` | sun | "Weather" | | clock | `#c084fc` | clock | "Clock" | | chart | `#f97316` | chart | "Chart" | | metric | `#22d3ee` | trending | (from metadata) | | list | `#a78bfa` | list | (from metadata) | | hacker_news | `#f97316` | newspaper | "News" | | website | `#60a5fa` | globe | (from metadata) | **CSS additions** in `style.css`: ```css .canvas-component-header { display: flex; align-items: center; gap: 0.375rem; padding: 0.5rem 0.75rem; font-size: 0.7rem; font-weight: 700; letter-spacing: 0.05em; text-transform: uppercase; border-bottom: 1px solid var(--border); cursor: grab; } .canvas-component-header .header-icon { width: 14px; height: 14px; } .canvas-component-header .header-grip { margin-left: auto; opacity: 0; transition: opacity 0.15s; } .canvas-component:hover .header-grip { opacity: 0.5; } ``` Reduce `.canvas-component-content` padding slightly to `0.75rem`. ## 3. Floating Component Toolbar **Files:** `web/public/js/controllers/canvas_controller.js`, `web/public/css/style.css` Replace the right-click component context menu with a floating toolbar that appears when a component is clicked/selected. **Selection behavior:** - Click a component add `.selected` class, show toolbar below it - Click canvas background or another component deselect previous - Toolbar positioned absolutely relative to canvas world, centered below the selected component **Toolbar HTML** (created dynamically in JS): ```html
``` **Toolbar actions:** - **Move** visual indicator that drag is active (already works via header/component drag) - **Style** opens a small color picker popover (6-8 preset colors) for `title_color` - **A A A** cycles component font size (small/medium/large, stored in metadata `font_size`) - **Duplicate** same as current context menu duplicate logic - **Delete** same as current context menu delete logic **CSS:** ```css .canvas-component-toolbar { position: absolute; display: flex; align-items: center; gap: 2px; background: #1a1a1e; border: 1px solid var(--border); border-radius: var(--radius-lg); padding: 0.25rem; box-shadow: var(--shadow-lg); z-index: 100; } .canvas-component.selected { border-color: var(--primary); box-shadow: 0 0 0 2px color-mix(in srgb, var(--primary) 20%, transparent); } ``` Keep the right-click context menu for the canvas background (adding widgets, scroll/edit lock, reset view). ## 4. Website Card Widget (new) **New files:** - `fang/widgets/website_widget.rb` - `web/public/js/widgets/website.js` **Widget behavior:** - `widget_type 'website'`, `menu_label 'Add Website'`, `menu_icon` globe SVG - `refreshable? = true`, `refresh_interval = 3600` (1 hour) - Metadata: `{ url:, selector: (optional CSS selector), title: }` - `refresh_data!` fetches URL via `Net::HTTP`, parses HTML with Nokogiri (or basic regex extraction), extracts content within `selector` or full page body, sanitizes HTML, stores as `content` - Renders: header "WEBSITE" with globe icon, then the fetched snippet content below, with a small footer showing the source URL and last-fetched timestamp **Route addition** in `web/app.rb`: - No new route needed uses existing `POST /api/pages/:id/components` and `PATCH` for metadata updates - Widget refresh handled by existing `ScheduledTaskRunnerJob` / widget refresh system **Client-side** (`website.js`): - Register widget behavior that shows a URL + optional CSS selector input when first created (empty state) - On URL submit, PATCHes component metadata, triggers server-side refresh ## 5. Sidebar Enhancement **File:** `web/views/layout.erb` (lines 57-68) Redesign sidebar to match Nova's grid listing: - Add "CANVASES" heading with `+` button (creates new canvas via existing `POST /api/canvases`) - Show component count badge next to each page name: `Page.title` + `page.canvas_components.count` - Active canvas gets highlighted background - Slightly larger font, more padding between items ```erb
CANVASES
<% Fang::Page.published.recent.each do |page| %> <%= page.title %> <%= page.canvas_components.count %> <% end %>
``` **CSS additions:** ```css .sidebar-heading { font-size: 0.7rem; font-weight: 600; letter-spacing: 0.08em; text-transform: uppercase; color: var(--muted-foreground); } .sidebar-count { font-size: 0.75rem; color: var(--muted-foreground); min-width: 1.5rem; text-align: right; } .sidebar-link { display: flex; justify-content: space-between; align-items: center; } ``` ## 6. Warm dark theme (CSS tokens only zero risk) 2. Card header system (BaseWidget + widget defaults + CSS) 3. Component selection state + floating toolbar (JS + CSS) 4. Sidebar enhancement (ERB + CSS) 5. Website card widget (new Ruby + JS files) 6. Polish & interaction tweaks ## Verification 1. Start server with `./openfang.rb server` 2. Open browser to localhost:3000 3. content.text:
The plan is ready. It covers 6 areas:

1. **Warm dark theme**  update CSS tokens from cold black to warm dark
2. **Card headers**  colored uppercase titles with icons, matching Nova's style
3. **Floating toolbar**  replaces right-click on components with a Nova-style toolbar (move, 8-color picker, font size A/A/A, duplicate, delete)
4. **Sidebar enhancement**  "CANVASES" heading, component counts, `+` button
5. **Website card widget**  new widget using Nokogiri to fetch/display website snippets with CSS selector support
6. **Polish**  selection state, double-click to add, smoother panning

# Nova-Style Canvas Redesign ## Context Transform OpenFang's canvas UI to match Nova's (nova.lightmode.io) aesthetic and interaction patterns warm dark theme, colored card headers, floating component toolbar, website snippet cards while keeping OpenFang's terminal chat footer and existing widget system. ## 1. Card Header System **Files:** `fang/widgets/base_widget.rb`, all widget files Add a card header bar to `render_component_html` in `BaseWidget`: - Renders a `.canvas-component-header` div above `.canvas-component-content` - Shows colored title text + optional icon from metadata (`title`, `title_color`, `icon`) - Each widget provides default `header_title`, `header_color`, `header_icon` class methods - Small grip/drag handle icon on the right side of header (for dragging) Widget defaults: | Widget | Color | Icon (SVG) | Title | |--------|-------|------------|-------| | card/note | `#a1a1aa` | doc | (from metadata or "Note") | | weather | `#38bdf8` | sun | "Weather" | | clock | `#c084fc` | clock | "Clock" | | chart | `#f97316` | chart | "Chart" | | metric | `#22d3ee` | trending | (from metadata) | | list | `#a78bfa` | list | (from metadata) | | hacker_news | `#f97316` | newspaper | "News" | | website | `#60a5fa` | globe | (from metadata) | **CSS additions** in `style.css`: ```css .canvas-component-header { display: flex; align-items: center; gap: 0.375rem; padding: 0.5rem 0.75rem; font-size: 0.7rem; font-weight: 700; letter-spacing: 0.05em; text-transform: uppercase; border-bottom: 1px solid var(--border); cursor: grab; } .canvas-component-header .header-icon { width: 14px; height: 14px; } .canvas-component-header .header-grip { margin-left: auto; opacity: 0; transition: opacity 0.15s; } .canvas-component:hover .header-grip { opacity: 0.5; } ``` Reduce `.canvas-component-content` padding slightly to `0.75rem`. ## 3. Floating Component Toolbar **Files:** `web/public/js/controllers/canvas_controller.js`, `web/public/css/style.css` Replace the right-click component context menu with a floating toolbar that appears when a component is clicked/selected. **Selection behavior:** - Click a component add `.selected` class, show toolbar below it - Click canvas background or another component deselect previous - Toolbar positioned absolutely relative to canvas world, centered below the selected component **Toolbar HTML** (created dynamically in JS): ```html
``` **Toolbar actions:** - **Move** visual indicator that drag is active (already works via header/component drag) - **Style** opens a small color picker popover with 8 curated presets (red `#ef4444`, orange `#f97316`, amber `#f59e0b`, green `#22c55e`, teal `#14b8a6`, blue `#60a5fa`, purple `#a78bfa`, gray `#a1a1aa`) for `title_color` - **A A A** cycles component font size (small/medium/large, stored in metadata `font_size`) - **Duplicate** same as current context menu duplicate logic - **Delete** same as current context menu delete logic **CSS:** ```css .canvas-component-toolbar { position: absolute; display: flex; align-items: center; gap: 2px; background: #1a1a1e; border: 1px solid var(--border); border-radius: var(--radius-lg); padding: 0.25rem; box-shadow: var(--shadow-lg); z-index: 100; } .canvas-component.selected { border-color: var(--primary); box-shadow: 0 0 0 2px color-mix(in srgb, var(--primary) 20%, transparent); } ``` Keep the right-click context menu for the canvas background (adding widgets, scroll/edit lock, reset view). ## 4. Website Card Widget (new) **New files:** - `fang/widgets/website_widget.rb` - `web/public/js/widgets/website.js` **Widget behavior:** - `widget_type 'website'`, `menu_label 'Add Website'`, `menu_icon` globe SVG - `refreshable? = true`, `refresh_interval = 3600` (1 hour) - Metadata: `{ url:, selector: (optional CSS selector), title: }` - `refresh_data!` fetches URL via `Net::HTTP`, parses HTML with **Nokogiri** (add `gem 'nokogiri'` to Gemfile), extracts content within CSS `selector` or falls back to ``, sanitizes HTML, stores as `content` - Renders: header "WEBSITE" with globe icon, then the fetched snippet content below, with a small footer showing the source URL and last-fetched timestamp **Route addition** in `web/app.rb`: - No new route needed uses existing `POST /api/pages/:id/components` and `PATCH` for metadata updates - Widget refresh handled by existing `ScheduledTaskRunnerJob` / widget refresh system **Client-side** (`website.js`): - Register widget behavior that shows a URL + optional CSS selector input when first created (empty state) - On URL submit, PATCHes component metadata, triggers server-side refresh ## 5. Sidebar Enhancement **File:** `web/views/layout.erb` (lines 57-68) Redesign sidebar to match Nova's grid listing: - Add "CANVASES" heading with `+` button (creates new canvas via existing `POST /api/canvases`) - Show component count badge next to each page name: `Page.title` + `page.canvas_components.count` - Active canvas gets highlighted background - Slightly larger font, more padding between items ```erb
CANVASES
<% Fang::Page.published.recent.each do |page| %> <%= page.title %> <%= page.canvas_components.count %> <% end %>
``` **CSS additions:** ```css .sidebar-heading { font-size: 0.7rem; font-weight: 600; letter-spacing: 0.08em; text-transform: uppercase; color: var(--muted-foreground); } .sidebar-count { font-size: 0.75rem; color: var(--muted-foreground); min-width: 1.5rem; text-align: right; } .sidebar-link { display: flex; justify-content: space-between; align-items: center; } ``` ## 6. Minor Canvas Interaction Polish **File:** `web/public/js/controllers/canvas_controller.js` - Double-click on empty canvas opens context menu (add widget) at that position - Smoother pan with `will-change: transform` on `.canvas-world` ## Files to Modify | File | Changes | |------|---------| | `web/public/css/style.css` | Warm theme tokens, card header, toolbar, selection, sidebar styles | | `fang/widgets/base_widget.rb` | Add header rendering to `render_component_html`, header class methods | | `fang/widgets/note_widget.rb` | Add `header_color`, `header_icon`, `header_title` defaults | | `fang/widgets/weather_widget.rb` | Same header defaults | | `fang/widgets/clock_widget.rb` | Same | | `fang/widgets/chart_widget.rb` | Same | | `fang/widgets/metric_widget.rb` | Same | | `fang/widgets/list_widget.rb` | Same | | `fang/widgets/hacker_news_widget.rb` | Same | | `web/public/js/controllers/canvas_controller.js` | Selection state, floating toolbar, color picker, font size, double-click | | `web/views/layout.erb` | Sidebar redesign with headings + counts | | **NEW** `fang/widgets/website_widget.rb` | Website snippet widget | | **NEW** `web/public/js/widgets/website.js` | Client-side behavior for website widget | ## Implementation Order 1. Warm dark theme (CSS tokens only zero risk) 2. Card header system (BaseWidget + widget defaults + CSS) 3. Component selection state + floating toolbar (JS + CSS) 4. Sidebar enhancement (ERB + CSS) 5. Website card widget (new Ruby + JS files) 6. Polish & interaction tweaks ## Verification 1. Start server with `./openfang.rb server` 2. Open browser to localhost:3000 3. Create a new canvas via "+" button 4. Right-click canvas add Note, Weather, Clock widgets 5. Verify: warm dark theme, colored card headers, dot grid background 6. Click a component floating toolbar appears below it 7. Test toolbar: change color, cycle font size, duplicate, delete 8. Right-click canvas background context menu still works for adding widgets 9. Add a Website widget enter a URL verify it fetches and displays snippet 10. Check sidebar shows canvas names with component counts

Good question. Looking at the existing widget JS architecture  all client-side widget behaviors use the `window.registerWidget(type, behavior)` pattern from `web/public/js/widgets/registry.js`, not Stimulus controllers. The canvas controller (Stimulus) handles the canvas-level concerns (pan/zoom/drag), while individual widget behaviors are plain JS registered via the widget registry.

The website widget JS should follow this same pattern  it goes in `web/public/js/widgets/website.js` using `registerWidget('website', { init(el), destroy(el) })`. The `init` function would handle the empty-state URL input form and submit behavior. No Stimulus controller needed  consistent with how clock.js, chart.js, and data_table.js already work.

content.thinking:
The user is asking about the website widget implementation approach - iframe vs server-side fetch. Let me think about the tradeoffs:

**iframe approach:**
- Pros: Preserves user's auth/cookies, live interactive content, no server-side fetching needed
- Cons: Many sites block iframing via X-Frame-Options/CSP, CORS issues, can't apply CSS selectors to extract snippets, security concerns (clickjacking), doesn't match Nova's "snippet" concept

**Server-side fetch approach:**
- Pros: Can extract specific CSS selectors, sanitize content, cache it, works with any site


- Cons: No user auth (fetches as anonymous), can't access authenticated content

The server-side approach aligns better with Nova's snippet concept of static content extraction, but it loses access to authenticated pageswhich is a real limitation I should clarify with the user.

content.text:
Great question. There are two distinct approaches with different tradeoffs:

**Server-side fetch (Nokogiri)**  what the plan currently describes:
- Fetches the URL from the server, extracts content via CSS selector, sanitizes and displays as static HTML
- Matches Nova's "snippet" concept  a snapshot that refreshes periodically
- Works with any public site, can target specific selectors
- Cannot access authenticated/logged-in content (fetches anonymously)

**iframe approach:**
- Embeds the live site in an `<iframe>`  preserves the user's browser session/cookies/auth
- Shows live interactive content, not a snapshot
- Many sites block iframing (`X-Frame-Options: DENY`, CSP `frame-ancestors`)
- Can't extract specific CSS selectors  shows the whole page (or nothing if blocked)

Most sites that matter (dashboards, news, etc.) block iframes, so it's unreliable as a primary approach. The Nova-style "snippet" is fundamentally a server-side extraction.

questions.question: Which approach for the Website widget?

options.label: Server-side fetch only (Recommended)
options.description: Nokogiri extracts snippets server-side. Works reliably with public content. Matches Nova's 'follow a snippet' concept. No auth support.

options.label: Dual mode: iframe + fallback
options.description: Try iframe first (works for sites that allow it, preserves auth). Fall back to server-side fetch if iframe is blocked. User picks mode per card.

options.label: iframe only
options.description: Simple iframe embed. Preserves auth but many sites will block it. No CSS selector extraction.

- `refresh_data!` fetches URL via `Net::HTTP`, parses HTML with **Nokogiri** (add `gem 'nokogiri'` to Gemfile), extracts content within CSS `selector` or falls back to `<body>`, sanitizes HTML, stores as `content`
- Renders: header "WEBSITE" with globe icon, then the fetched snippet content below, with a small footer showing the source URL and last-fetched timestamp

**Route addition** in `web/app.rb`:
- No new route needed  uses existing `POST /api/pages/:id/components` and `PATCH` for metadata updates
- Widget refresh handled by existing `ScheduledTaskRunnerJob` / widget refresh system

**Client-side** (`website.js`)  uses the existing widget registry pattern (NOT Stimulus):
```js
registerWidget('website', {
  init(el) { /* empty-state URL form, submit handler */ },
  destroy(el) { /* cleanup */ }
})
```
- Shows a URL + optional CSS selector input when first created (empty state)
- On URL submit, PATCHes component metadata, triggers server-side refresh
- Follows same pattern as `clock.js`, `chart.js`, `data_table.js`

- `widget_type 'website'`, `menu_label 'Add Website'`, `menu_icon` globe SVG
