- **iframe mode** (default): renders an `<iframe src="url">`  preserves user's browser auth/cookies. Works for sites that allow framing.
- **snippet mode** (fallback): `refresh_data!` fetches URL via `Net::HTTP`, parses with **Nokogiri** (`gem 'nokogiri'`), extracts content within CSS `selector` or falls back to `<body>`, sanitizes HTML, stores as `content`. Shows static snapshot that refreshes periodically.
- User can toggle mode per card via the toolbar or a small toggle in the card header
- Renders: header with globe icon, iframe or fetched content below, small footer with source URL

**Route addition** in `web/app.rb`:
- No new route needed  uses existing `POST /api/pages/:id/components` and `PATCH` for metadata updates
- Widget refresh handled by existing widget refresh system (snippet mode only)

**Client-side** (`website.js`)  uses the existing widget registry pattern (NOT Stimulus):
```js
registerWidget('website', {
  init(el) { /* empty-state URL form, mode toggle, iframe/snippet render */ },
  destroy(el) { /* cleanup */ }
})
```
- Shows a URL input + mode toggle (iframe/snippet) when first created (empty state)
- In snippet mode: also shows optional CSS selector field
- On submit, PATCHes component metadata, triggers render (iframe) or server-side refresh (snippet)
- Follows same pattern as `clock.js`, `chart.js`, `data_table.js`

# Nova-Style Canvas Redesign ## Context Transform OpenFang's canvas UI to match Nova's (nova.lightmode.io) aesthetic and interaction patterns warm dark theme, colored card headers, floating component toolbar, website snippet cards while keeping OpenFang's terminal chat footer and existing widget system. ## 1. Warm Dark Theme **File:** `web/public/css/style.css` (lines 46-68, dark mode tokens) Update dark mode CSS custom properties: ``` --background: #1a1a1e (warm dark, was #09090b) --card: #242428 (slightly lighter, was #18181b) --muted: #2e2e33 (was #27272a) --border: #3a3a40 (warmer, was #27272a) --muted-foreground: #9a9aaa ``` Also update canvas dot grid color to match warmer palette. ## 2. Card Header System **Files:** `fang/widgets/base_widget.rb`, all widget files Add a card header bar to `render_component_html` in `BaseWidget`: - Renders a `.canvas-component-header` div above `.canvas-component-content` - Shows colored title text + optional icon from metadata (`title`, `title_color`, `icon`) - Each widget provides default `header_title`, `header_color`, `header_icon` class methods - Small grip/drag handle icon on the right side of header (for dragging) Widget defaults: | Widget | Color | Icon (SVG) | Title | |--------|-------|------------|-------| | card/note | `#a1a1aa` | doc | (from metadata or "Note") | | weather | `#38bdf8` | sun | "Weather" | | clock | `#c084fc` | clock | "Clock" | | chart | `#f97316` | chart | "Chart" | | metric | `#22d3ee` | trending | (from metadata) | | list | `#a78bfa` | list | (from metadata) | | hacker_news | `#f97316` | newspaper | "News" | | website | `#60a5fa` | globe | (from metadata) | **CSS additions** in `style.css`: ```css .canvas-component-header { display: flex; align-items: center; gap: 0.375rem; padding: 0.5rem 0.75rem; font-size: 0.7rem; font-weight: 700; letter-spacing: 0.05em; text-transform: uppercase; border-bottom: 1px solid var(--border); cursor: grab; } .canvas-component-header .header-icon { width: 14px; height: 14px; } .canvas-component-header .header-grip { margin-left: auto; opacity: 0; transition: opacity 0.15s; } .canvas-component:hover .header-grip { opacity: 0.5; } ``` Reduce `.canvas-component-content` padding slightly to `0.75rem`. ## 3. Floating Component Toolbar **Files:** `web/public/js/controllers/canvas_controller.js`, `web/public/css/style.css` Replace the right-click component context menu with a floating toolbar that appears when a component is clicked/selected. **Selection behavior:** - Click a component add `.selected` class, show toolbar below it - Click canvas background or another component deselect previous - Toolbar positioned absolutely relative to canvas world, centered below the selected component **Toolbar HTML** (created dynamically in JS): ```html
``` **Toolbar actions:** - **Move** visual indicator that drag is active (already works via header/component drag) - **Style** opens a small color picker popover with 8 curated presets (red `#ef4444`, orange `#f97316`, amber `#f59e0b`, green `#22c55e`, teal `#14b8a6`, blue `#60a5fa`, purple `#a78bfa`, gray `#a1a1aa`) for `title_color` - **A A A** cycles component font size (small/medium/large, stored in metadata `font_size`) - **Duplicate** same as current context menu duplicate logic - **Delete** same as current context menu delete logic **CSS:** ```css .canvas-component-toolbar { position: absolute; display: flex; align-items: center; gap: 2px; background: #1a1a1e; border: 1px solid var(--border); border-radius: var(--radius-lg); padding: 0.25rem; box-shadow: var(--shadow-lg); z-index: 100; } .canvas-component.selected { border-color: var(--primary); box-shadow: 0 0 0 2px color-mix(in srgb, var(--primary) 20%, transparent); } ``` Keep the right-click context menu for the canvas background (adding widgets, scroll/edit lock, reset view). ## 4. Website Card Widget (new) **New files:** - `fang/widgets/website_widget.rb` - `web/public/js/widgets/website.js` **Widget behavior:** - `widget_type 'website'`, `menu_label 'Add Website'`, `menu_icon` globe SVG - `refreshable? = true`, `refresh_interval = 3600` (1 hour) - Metadata: `{ url:, selector: (optional CSS selector), title: }` - `refresh_data!` fetches URL via `Net::HTTP`, parses HTML with **Nokogiri** (add `gem 'nokogiri'` to Gemfile), extracts content within CSS `selector` or falls back to ``, sanitizes HTML, stores as `content` - Renders: header "WEBSITE" with globe icon, then the fetched snippet content below, with a small footer showing the source URL and last-fetched timestamp **Route addition** in `web/app.rb`: - No new route needed uses existing `POST /api/pages/:id/components` and `PATCH` for metadata updates - Widget refresh handled by existing `ScheduledTaskRunnerJob` / widget refresh system **Client-side** (`website.js`) uses the existing widget registry pattern (NOT Stimulus): ```js registerWidget('website', { init(el) { /* empty-state URL form, submit handler */ }, destroy(el) { /* cleanup */ } }) ``` - Shows a URL + optional CSS selector input when first created (empty state) - On URL submit, PATCHes component metadata, triggers server-side refresh - Follows same pattern as `clock.js`, `chart.js`, `data_table.js` ## 5. Sidebar Enhancement **File:** `web/views/layout.erb` (lines 57-68) Redesign sidebar to match Nova's grid listing: - Add "CANVASES" heading with `+` button (creates new canvas via existing `POST /api/canvases`) - Show component count badge next to each page name: `Page.title` + `page.canvas_components.count` - Active canvas gets highlighted background - Slightly larger font, more padding between items ```erb
CANVASES
<% Fang::Page.published.recent.each do |page| %> <%= page.title %> <%= page.canvas_components.count %> <% end %>
``` **CSS additions:** ```css .sidebar-heading { font-size: 0.7rem; font-weight: 600; letter-spacing: 0.08em; text-transform: uppercase; color: var(--muted-foreground); } .sidebar-count { font-size: 0.75rem; color: var(--muted-foreground); min-width: 1.5rem; text-align: right; } .sidebar-link { display: flex; justify-content: space-between; align-items: center; } ``` ## 6. Minor Canvas Interaction Polish **File:** `web/public/js/controllers/canvas_controller.js` - Double-click on empty canvas opens context menu (add widget) at that position - Smoother pan with `will-change: transform` on `.canvas-world` ## Files to Modify | File | Changes | |------|---------| | `web/public/css/style.css` | Warm theme tokens, card header, toolbar, selection, sidebar styles | | `fang/widgets/base_widget.rb` | Add header rendering to `render_component_html`, header class methods | | `fang/widgets/note_widget.rb` | Add `header_color`, `header_icon`, `header_title` defaults | | `fang/widgets/weather_widget.rb` | Same header defaults | | `fang/widgets/clock_widget.rb` | Same | | `fang/widgets/chart_widget.rb` | Same | | `fang/widgets/metric_widget.rb` | Same | | `fang/widgets/list_widget.rb` | Same | | `fang/widgets/hacker_news_widget.rb` | Same | | `web/public/js/controllers/canvas_controller.js` | Selection state, floating toolbar, color picker, font size, double-click | | `web/views/layout.erb` | Sidebar redesign with headings + counts | | **NEW** `fang/widgets/website_widget.rb` | Website snippet widget | | **NEW** `web/public/js/widgets/website.js` | Client-side behavior for website widget | ## Implementation Order 1. Warm dark theme (CSS tokens only zero risk) 2. Card header system (BaseWidget + widget defaults + CSS) 3. Component selection state + floating toolbar (JS + CSS) 4. Sidebar enhancement (ERB + CSS) 5. Website card widget (new Ruby + JS files) 6. Polish & interaction tweaks ## Verification 1. Start server with `./openfang.rb server` 2. Open browser to localhost:3000 3. Create a new canvas via "+" button 4. Right-click canvas add Note, Weather, Clock widgets 5. Verify: warm dark theme, colored card headers, dot grid background 6. Click a component floating toolbar appears below it 7. Test toolbar: change color, cycle font size, duplicate, delete 8. Right-click canvas background context menu still works for adding widgets 9. Add a Website widget enter a URL verify it fetches and displays snippet 10. Check sidebar shows canvas names with component counts

Error: The user doesn't want to proceed with this tool use. The tool use was rejected (eg. if it was a file edit, the new_string was NOT written to the file). To tell you how to proceed, the user said:
in iframe mode, can we crop just the part we want to show in the iframe?

content.text:
Unfortunately, you can't reliably crop/clip specific parts of a cross-origin iframe due to browser security (same-origin policy). The browser blocks any JS interaction with the iframe's DOM if it's from a different domain.

There are a couple of workarounds, but each has limits:

1. **CSS clip/transform trick**  Use `transform: scale()` + `clip-path` or `overflow: hidden` on a wrapper div, combined with negative `margin` or `transform: translate()` to "pan" the iframe to the area you want. This is purely visual  you position the iframe so only the desired region is visible. But it requires the user to manually dial in pixel offsets (x, y, width, height) which is tedious.

2. **Scroll the iframe**  For same-origin or sites that allow it, you can use `#:~:text=` fragment or anchor links to scroll to a section, but this is unreliable cross-origin.

3. **Server-side proxy**  Fetch the page server-side, extract the snippet, serve it from our own origin in the iframe. This gives full DOM control but loses user auth (same as snippet mode).

Realistically, the **snippet mode** is the right tool for "show just this part of the page." The iframe mode is better for "embed the whole page/app where I'm logged in" (like a dashboard, email, calendar).

questions.question: For iframe mode, should we add a visual cropping feature using CSS clip/translate (user enters pixel coordinates to frame a region), or keep iframe mode as full-page embed and use snippet mode when you want specific sections?

options.label: Keep iframe full-page (Recommended)
options.description: iframe = full page embed (good for dashboards/apps). snippet mode = extract specific sections. Clean separation of concerns.

options.label: Add CSS crop controls
options.description: Let users specify x, y, width, height offsets to visually crop the iframe. More flexible but requires manual pixel tuning.

You can now continue with the user's answers in mind.

Warm Dark Theme **File:** `web/public/css/style.css` (lines 46-68, dark mode tokens) Update dark mode CSS custom properties: ``` --background: #1a1a1e (warm dark, was #09090b) --card: #242428 (slightly lighter, was #18181b) --muted: #2e2e33 (was #27272a) --border: #3a3a40 (warmer, was #27272a) --muted-foreground: #9a9aaa ``` Also update canvas dot grid color to match warmer palette. ## 2. Card Header System **Files:** `fang/widgets/base_widget.rb`, all widget files Add a card header bar to `render_component_html` in `BaseWidget`: - Renders a `.canvas-component-header` div above `.canvas-component-content` - Shows colored title text + optional icon from metadata (`title`, `title_color`, `icon`) - Each widget provides default `header_title`, `header_color`, `header_icon` class methods - Small grip/drag handle icon on the right side of header (for dragging) Widget defaults: | Widget | Color | Icon (SVG) | Title | |--------|-------|------------|-------| | card/note | `#a1a1aa` | doc | (from metadata or "Note") | | weather | `#38bdf8` | sun | "Weather" | | clock | `#c084fc` | clock | "Clock" | | chart | `#f97316` | chart | "Chart" | | metric | `#22d3ee` | trending | (from metadata) | | list | `#a78bfa` | list | (from metadata) | | hacker_news | `#f97316` | newspaper | "News" | | website | `#60a5fa` | globe | (from metadata) | **CSS additions** in `style.css`: ```css .canvas-component-header { display: flex; align-items: center; gap: 0.375rem; padding: 0.5rem 0.75rem; font-size: 0.7rem; font-weight: 700; letter-spacing: 0.05em; text-transform: uppercase; border-bottom: 1px solid var(--border); cursor: grab; } .canvas-component-header .header-icon { width: 14px; height: 14px; } .canvas-component-header .header-grip { margin-left: auto; opacity: 0; transition: opacity 0.15s; } .canvas-component:hover .header-grip { opacity: 0.5; } ``` Reduce `.canvas-component-content` padding slightly to `0.75rem`. ## 3. Floating Component Toolbar **Files:** `web/public/js/controllers/canvas_controller.js`, `web/public/css/style.css` Replace the right-click component context menu with a floating toolbar that appears when a component is clicked/selected. **Selection behavior:** - Click a component add `.selected` class, show toolbar below it - Click canvas background or another component deselect previous - Toolbar positioned absolutely relative to canvas world, centered below the selected component **Toolbar HTML** (created dynamically in JS): ```html
``` **Toolbar actions:** - **Move** visual indicator that drag is active (already works via header/component drag) - **Style** opens a small color picker popover with 8 curated presets (red `#ef4444`, orange `#f97316`, amber `#f59e0b`, green `#22c55e`, teal `#14b8a6`, blue `#60a5fa`, purple `#a78bfa`, gray `#a1a1aa`) for `title_color` - **A A A** cycles component font size (small/medium/large, stored in metadata `font_size`) - **Duplicate** same as current context menu duplicate logic - **Delete** same as current context menu delete logic **CSS:** ```css .canvas-component-toolbar { position: absolute; display: flex; align-items: center; gap: 2px; background: #1a1a1e; border: 1px solid var(--border); border-radius: var(--radius-lg); padding: 0.25rem; box-shadow: var(--shadow-lg); z-index: 100; } .canvas-component.selected { border-color: var(--primary); box-shadow: 0 0 0 2px color-mix(in srgb, var(--primary) 20%, transparent); } ``` Keep the right-click context menu for the canvas background (adding widgets, scroll/edit lock, reset view). ## 4. Website Card Widget (new) **New files:** - `fang/widgets/website_widget.rb` - `web/public/js/widgets/website.js` **Widget behavior Dual mode (iframe + server-side fallback):** - `widget_type 'website'`, `menu_label 'Add Website'`, `menu_icon` globe SVG - `refreshable? = true`, `refresh_interval = 3600` (1 hour) - Metadata: `{ url:, selector: (optional CSS selector), title:, mode: 'iframe'|'snippet' }` - **iframe mode** (default): renders an `

content.text:
Yes, exactly. When the user adds a Website widget (from the context menu), they'll see an initial setup form where they:

1. Enter the URL
2. Choose the mode: **"Embed (iframe)"** or **"Snippet"**
3. If snippet mode is selected, an additional optional field appears for the CSS selector

They can also switch modes later via the floating toolbar or a small toggle in the card. The mode is stored in metadata as `mode: 'iframe'` or `mode: 'snippet'`.

The empty-state form in the card would look something like:

```

  WEBSITE                  
                             
  URL: [________________]    
                             
   Embed (live page)        
   Snippet (extract part)   
                             
    Selector: [________]        only visible in snippet mode
                             
  [Add Website]              

```

input.old_string:
- Metadata: `{ url:, selector: (optional CSS selector), title:, mode: 'iframe'|'snippet' }`
- **iframe mode** (default): renders an `<iframe src="url">`  preserves user's browser auth/cookies. Works for sites that allow framing.
- **snippet mode** (fallback): `refresh_data!` fetches URL via `Net::HTTP`, parses with **Nokogiri** (`gem 'nokogiri'`), extracts content within CSS `selector` or falls back to `<body>`, sanitizes HTML, stores as `content`. Shows static snapshot that refreshes periodically.
- User can toggle mode per card via the toolbar or a small toggle in the card header

content.thinking:
The user is suggesting a different approach - instead of the user manually entering CSS selectors, they should describe in natural language what they want from a website (e.g., "show me the top stories from Hacker News" or "show the current weather forecast"), and the AI agent (the Claude subprocess) would use the existing MCP tools to create the widget with the right code/configuration.

This makes much more sense for OpenFang's architecture - the inner AI agent already has MCP tools like `create_page`, `run_code`, etc. So the flow would be:

1. User tells the AI "add a website card that shows the top HN stories"


2. The AI leverages those MCP tools to generate the widget configuration, including the URL, selectors, and any custom extraction logic needed
3. The widget then refreshes automatically using that AI-generated setup

This is a much better UX than asking users to write CSS selectors themselves - they just describe what they want in plain language and the system figures out the rest.

content.text:
That's a much better approach for OpenFang's architecture. So instead of the user manually typing CSS selectors, the flow would be:

1. User adds a Website widget and enters the URL + a natural language description like *"Show me the top 5 headlines"* or *"Just the price table"*
2. This gets sent to the AI agent (Claude subprocess) which analyzes the page and generates the extraction logic  could be a CSS selector, or even custom Ruby code via `run_code` that fetches and transforms the data
3. The widget stores and uses that extraction config to refresh periodically

The AI would use the existing MCP tools (`run_code` to test extraction, PATCH the component metadata/content) to set up the snippet. The user never needs to know about CSS selectors.

For iframe mode, it stays simple  just the URL, no AI involvement needed.

questions.question: How should the AI-powered snippet extraction work?

options.label: AI generates CSS selector + stores it
options.description: AI analyzes the page, picks the right CSS selector, stores it in metadata. Nokogiri uses the selector on each refresh. Simpler, but limited to what CSS selectors can express.

options.label: AI generates Ruby extraction code
options.description: AI writes a small Ruby snippet (stored in metadata) that fetches + transforms the data. Runs via eval on each refresh. More powerful  can handle pagination, JSON APIs, complex transformations. Uses the existing run_code pattern.

options.label: AI builds full widget content directly
options.description: AI fetches the page, builds the HTML content, and stores it. On refresh, a scheduled task re-runs the AI prompt to update. Most flexible but uses AI tokens on every refresh.

content.content: User has answered your questions: "How should the AI-powered snippet extraction work?"="AI generates Ruby extraction code". You can now continue with the user's answers in mind.

options.label: AI builds full widget content directly
options.description: AI fetches the page, builds the HTML content, and stores it. On refresh, a scheduled task re-runs the AI prompt to update. Most flexible but uses AI tokens on every refresh.

content.thinking: So the AI generates a Ruby extraction snippet that's stored in metadata and evaluated on each refresh. This aligns with the existing `evaluate_data_source` pattern in `BaseWidget` which already does `instance_eval` on a Ruby string. Let me update the plan.

content.text: This aligns perfectly with the existing `evaluate_data_source` pattern in `BaseWidget` (line 56-68) which already does `instance_eval` on a Ruby code string. Let me update the plan.

input.old_string:
- Metadata: `{ url:, selector: (optional CSS selector), title:, mode: 'snippet'|'iframe' }`
- **snippet mode** (default): `refresh_data!` fetches URL via `Net::HTTP`, parses with **Nokogiri** (`gem 'nokogiri'`), extracts content within CSS `selector` or falls back to `<body>`, sanitizes HTML, stores as `content`. Shows static snapshot that refreshes periodically.
- **iframe mode** (opt-in): renders an `<iframe src="url">`  preserves user's browser auth/cookies. For when the user needs to stay logged in (dashboards, email, etc.).
- User can toggle mode per card via the setup form or the floating toolbar
input.new_string:
- Metadata: `{ url:, title:, mode: 'snippet'|'iframe', extraction_code: '...', description: '...' }`
- **snippet mode** (default, AI-powered): User enters a URL + natural language description of what they want (e.g., "Show the top 5 headlines"). This is sent to the AI agent, which analyzes the page and generates a Ruby extraction snippet stored in `metadata.extraction_code`. On each refresh, the code is evaluated (same pattern as `BaseWidget#evaluate_data_source` at line 56) to fetch + transform the content. Uses **Nokogiri** (`gem 'nokogiri'`) for HTML parsing within the generated code.
- **iframe mode** (opt-in): renders `<iframe src="url">`  preserves user's browser auth/cookies. For dashboards, email, etc. No AI involvement.
- User selects mode in the setup form when adding the widget

# Nova-Style Canvas Redesign ## Context Transform OpenFang's canvas UI to match Nova's (nova.lightmode.io) aesthetic and interaction patterns warm dark theme, colored card headers, floating component toolbar, website snippet cards while keeping OpenFang's terminal chat footer and existing widget system. ## 1. Warm Dark Theme **File:** `web/public/css/style.css` (lines 46-68, dark mode tokens) Update dark mode CSS custom properties: ``` --background: #1a1a1e (warm dark, was #09090b) --card: #242428 (slightly lighter, was #18181b) --muted: #2e2e33 (was #27272a) --border: #3a3a40 (warmer, was #27272a) --muted-foreground: #9a9aaa ``` Also update canvas dot grid color to match warmer palette. ## 2. Card Header System **Files:** `fang/widgets/base_widget.rb`, all widget files Add a card header bar to `render_component_html` in `BaseWidget`: - Renders a `.canvas-component-header` div above `.canvas-component-content` - Shows colored title text + optional icon from metadata (`title`, `title_color`, `icon`) - Each widget provides default `header_title`, `header_color`, `header_icon` class methods - Small grip/drag handle icon on the right side of header (for dragging) Widget defaults: | Widget | Color | Icon (SVG) | Title | |--------|-------|------------|-------| | card/note | `#a1a1aa` | doc | (from metadata or "Note") | | weather | `#38bdf8` | sun | "Weather" | | clock | `#c084fc` | clock | "Clock" | | chart | `#f97316` | chart | "Chart" | | metric | `#22d3ee` | trending | (from metadata) | | list | `#a78bfa` | list | (from metadata) | | hacker_news | `#f97316` | newspaper | "News" | | website | `#60a5fa` | globe | (from metadata) | **CSS additions** in `style.css`: ```css .canvas-component-header { display: flex; align-items: center; gap: 0.375rem; padding: 0.5rem 0.75rem; font-size: 0.7rem; font-weight: 700; letter-spacing: 0.05em; text-transform: uppercase; border-bottom: 1px solid var(--border); cursor: grab; } .canvas-component-header .header-icon { width: 14px; height: 14px; } .canvas-component-header .header-grip { margin-left: auto; opacity: 0; transition: opacity 0.15s; } .canvas-component:hover .header-grip { opacity: 0.5; } ``` Reduce `.canvas-component-content` padding slightly to `0.75rem`. ## 3. Floating Component Toolbar **Files:** `web/public/js/controllers/canvas_controller.js`, `web/public/css/style.css` Replace the right-click component context menu with a floating toolbar that appears when a component is clicked/selected. **Selection behavior:** - Click a component add `.selected` class, show toolbar below it - Click canvas background or another component deselect previous - Toolbar positioned absolutely relative to canvas world, centered below the selected component **Toolbar HTML** (created dynamically in JS): ```html
``` **Toolbar actions:** - **Move** visual indicator that drag is active (already works via header/component drag) - **Style** opens a small color picker popover with 8 curated presets (red `#ef4444`, orange `#f97316`, amber `#f59e0b`, green `#22c55e`, teal `#14b8a6`, blue `#60a5fa`, purple `#a78bfa`, gray `#a1a1aa`) for `title_color` - **A A A** cycles component font size (small/medium/large, stored in metadata `font_size`) - **Duplicate** same as current context menu duplicate logic - **Delete** same as current context menu delete logic **CSS:** ```css .canvas-component-toolbar { position: absolute; display: flex; align-items: center; gap: 2px; background: #1a1a1e; border: 1px solid var(--border); border-radius: var(--radius-lg); padding: 0.25rem; box-shadow: var(--shadow-lg); z-index: 100; } .canvas-component.selected { border-color: var(--primary); box-shadow: 0 0 0 2px color-mix(in srgb, var(--primary) 20%, transparent); } ``` Keep the right-click context menu for the canvas background (adding widgets, scroll/edit lock, reset view). ## 4. Website Card Widget (new) **New files:** - `fang/widgets/website_widget.rb` - `web/public/js/widgets/website.js` **Widget behavior Dual mode (iframe + server-side fallback):** - `widget_type 'website'`, `menu_label 'Add Website'`, `menu_icon` globe SVG - `refreshable? = true`, `refresh_interval = 3600` (1 hour) - Metadata: `{ url:, selector: (optional CSS selector), title:, mode: 'snippet'|'iframe' }` - **snippet mode** (default): `refresh_data!` fetches URL via `Net::HTTP`, parses with **Nokogiri** (`gem 'nokogiri'`), extracts content within CSS `selector` or falls back to ``, sanitizes HTML, stores as `content`. Shows static snapshot that refreshes periodically. - **iframe mode** (opt-in): renders an `

Card Header System **Files:** `fang/widgets/base_widget.rb`, all widget files Add a card header bar to `render_component_html` in `BaseWidget`: - Renders a `.canvas-component-header` div above `.canvas-component-content` - Shows colored title text + optional icon from metadata (`title`, `title_color`, `icon`) - Each widget provides default `header_title`, `header_color`, `header_icon` class methods - Small grip/drag handle icon on the right side of header (for dragging) Widget defaults: | Widget | Color | Icon (SVG) | Title | |--------|-------|------------|-------| | card/note | `#a1a1aa` | doc | (from metadata or "Note") | | weather | `#38bdf8` | sun | "Weather" | | clock | `#c084fc` | clock | "Clock" | | chart | `#f97316` | chart | "Chart" | | metric | `#22d3ee` | trending | (from metadata) | | list | `#a78bfa` | list | (from metadata) | | hacker_news | `#f97316` | newspaper | "News" | | website | `#60a5fa` | globe | (from metadata) | **CSS additions** in `style.css`: ```css .canvas-component-header { display: flex; align-items: center; gap: 0.375rem; padding: 0.5rem 0.75rem; font-size: 0.7rem; font-weight: 700; letter-spacing: 0.05em; text-transform: uppercase; border-bottom: 1px solid var(--border); cursor: grab; } .canvas-component-header .header-icon { width: 14px; height: 14px; } .canvas-component-header .header-grip { margin-left: auto; opacity: 0; transition: opacity 0.15s; } .canvas-component:hover .header-grip { opacity: 0.5; } ``` Reduce `.canvas-component-content` padding slightly to `0.75rem`. ## 3. Floating Component Toolbar **Files:** `web/public/js/controllers/canvas_controller.js`, `web/public/css/style.css` Replace the right-click component context menu with a floating toolbar that appears when a component is clicked/selected. **Selection behavior:** - Click a component add `.selected` class, show toolbar below it - Click canvas background or another component deselect previous - Toolbar positioned absolutely relative to canvas world, centered below the selected component **Toolbar HTML** (created dynamically in JS): ```html
``` **Toolbar actions:** - **Move** visual indicator that drag is active (already works via header/component drag) - **Style** opens a small color picker popover with 8 curated presets (red `#ef4444`, orange `#f97316`, amber `#f59e0b`, green `#22c55e`, teal `#14b8a6`, blue `#60a5fa`, purple `#a78bfa`, gray `#a1a1aa`) for `title_color` - **A A A** cycles component font size (small/medium/large, stored in metadata `font_size`) - **Duplicate** same as current context menu duplicate logic - **Delete** same as current context menu delete logic **CSS:** ```css .canvas-component-toolbar { position: absolute; display: flex; align-items: center; gap: 2px; background: #1a1a1e; border: 1px solid var(--border); border-radius: var(--radius-lg); padding: 0.25rem; box-shadow: var(--shadow-lg); z-index: 100; } .canvas-component.selected { border-color: var(--primary); box-shadow: 0 0 0 2px color-mix(in srgb, var(--primary) 20%, transparent); } ``` Keep the right-click context menu for the canvas background (adding widgets, scroll/edit lock, reset view). ## 4. Website Card Widget (new) **New files:** - `fang/widgets/website_widget.rb` - `web/public/js/widgets/website.js` **Widget behavior Dual mode (iframe + server-side fallback):** - `widget_type 'website'`, `menu_label 'Add Website'`, `menu_icon` globe SVG - `refreshable? = true`, `refresh_interval = 3600` (1 hour) - Metadata: `{ url:, title:, mode: 'snippet'|'iframe', extraction_code: '...', description: '...' }` - **snippet mode** (default, AI-powered): User enters a URL + natural language description of what they want (e.g., "Show the top 5 headlines"). This is sent to the AI agent, which analyzes the page and generates a Ruby extraction snippet stored in `metadata.extraction_code`. On each refresh, the code is evaluated (same pattern as `BaseWidget#evaluate_data_source` at line 56) to fetch + transform the content. Uses **Nokogiri** (`gem 'nokogiri'`) for HTML parsing within the generated code. - **iframe mode** (opt-in): renders `

<button data-action="duplicate" title="Duplicate"><svg>copy</svg></button>
<button data-action="delete" title="Delete"><svg>trash</svg></button>
- **Move**  visual indicator that drag is active (already works via header/component drag)

- **Style**  opens a small color picker popover with 8 curated presets (red `#ef4444`, orange `#f97316`, amber `#f59e0b`, green `#22c55e`, teal `#14b8a6`, blue `#60a5fa`, purple `#a78bfa`, gray `#a1a1aa`) for `title_color`
- **A A A**  cycles component font size (small/medium/large, stored in metadata `font_size`)
+- **Chat about this**  same as current context menu "Chat about this" (creates conversation, prefills with component content)
- **Duplicate**  same as current context menu duplicate logic
- **Delete**  same as current context menu delete logic
